0.title: Maha government agrees to transfer Palghar mob lynching case to CBI
0.article_body: The Maharashtra government has agreed to transfer investigation of the 2020 Palghar mob lynching case to the CBI. Earlier, the government had informed the SC that all guilty police officials involved in the case had been punished. On April 16, 2020, a mob lynched two sadhus and their driver while they were travelling to Surat from Mumbai.

1.title: PM Modi wishes Amitabh Bachchan on his 80th birthday, actor responds
1.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday wished actor Amitabh Bachchan on his 80th birthday. "He's one of India's most remarkable film personalities who has enthralled and entertained audiences across generations. May he lead a long and healthy life," PM Modi tweeted. "I thank you for your...wishes. Your words of blessing will always be a source of inspiration for me," Bachchan responded.

2.title: Woman receives cow dung after ordering ₹1,300 watch from Flipkart in UP
2.article_body: A woman from Uttar Pradesh has claimed that she received cow dung in her Flipkart package after placing an order for a ₹1,304 watch. The order was placed during the e-commerce website's Big Billion Days Sale in September. The delivery executive returned the money and collected the delivered item after the woman's brother chased him to settle the grievance.

3.title: Man says he's an astronaut, scams Japan woman into paying for 'return ticket to Earth'
3.article_body: A man pretended to be a Russian astronaut to scam a 65-year-old Japanese woman of ₹25 lakh (4.4 million yen) in the name of a 'return ticket to Earth'. The man, who found the woman on Instagram, told the woman they'd start a life together in Japan on his return. The woman grew suspicious when the man became more demanding.

4.title: I was very, very hard on myself in my 20s: 'Mirzapur' actress Shriya
4.article_body: Actress Shriya Pilgaonkar, who portrayed the character of Sweety Gupta in 'Mirzapur', said she was "very, very hard" on herself in her 20s. Shriya added she started accepting herself wholly during her late 20s. "Every person has their own journey with...when they're going to find love...Social media...has sold this notion to us of how love has to be," stated Shriya.

5.title: Cylinder bursts in kitchen of restaurant in Pune; no casualties
5.article_body: A fire that broke out after a cylinder burst in a restaurant's kitchen in Pune's Hadapsar was contained within a few minutes on Tuesday, a fire officer said. The officer added that a major blaze was averted as a team managed to remove six other cylinders from the kitchen while another team doused the fire. No casualties were reported.

6.title: We have ability to detect & intercept N Korea's missiles: S Korea
6.article_body: South Korean military has said that the country's missile defence system is capable of detecting and intercepting the weapons systems that North Korea said it mobilised in its drills. On Monday, North Korea said that its drills involved nuclear-capable ballistic missiles, warplanes meant to warn Seoul and Washington. South Korea described North Korea's nuclear threats as "very grave and serious".

7.title: All of Ukraine put on alert after Russian missile strikes
7.article_body: Emergency services put all of Ukraine on alert for more missile strikes on Tuesday, a day after Russian missile strikes killed 19 people and wounded over 100 others. "Warning. During the day there's high probability of missile strikes on the territory of Ukraine. Please remain in shelters for your own safety, do not ignore air raid signals," the alert read.

8.title: Some Meta staff refer to metaverse projects as 'make Mark happy': Report
8.article_body: Some employees working at Meta jokingly refer to key metaverse projects as MMH, for "make Mark happy" as its CEO Mark Zuckerberg shifts his priorities, according to a report. The report stated that a shift in priorities has caused a frequent shuffling of employees at the company. Some Meta employees have also complained about frequent strategy shifts, the report added.

9.title: It's a chance I thought would never come round again: Alex Hales on T20 WC
9.article_body: England opener Alex Hales revealed that he didn't see himself playing in the upcoming T20 World Cup a few months ago. "It's a chance I thought would never come round again," added Hales, who replaced injured Jonny Bairstow in England's World Cup squad. The 33-year-old is currently playing in T20Is against Australia and scored 84(51) in the first match.

10.title: Truck carrying scrap metal catches fire on Bengaluru's NICE road; traffic hit
10.article_body: A truck carrying iron and scrap metal caught fire on Bengaluru's NICE road, which affected traffic movement in the area. The truck was reportedly transporting metal materials from Kerala to Maharashtra. The incident occurred after one of the back tyres caught fire, which soon spread to other tyres and the rear half of the truck, a report said.

11.title: I've always been concerned about space for independent music: Kamal
11.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan said he has "always" been concerned about the fact that no space has been provided to facilitate independent music. "We are now only scoring music that is demanded by producers...for stories that they are looking to make into films for almost 100 years," added Kamal. "Even a great musician like Ilaiyaraaja has been forcibly constrained," he stated.

12.title: N Korea has nothing to gain from nuclear weapons: S Korean President
12.article_body: After North Korea launched a series of ballistic missiles, South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol said the country has nothing to gain from nuclear weapons. "North Korea is...developing...its nuclear weapons and posing nuclear threats to not only our Republic of Korea but the world," he added. Yoon said he would build robust capabilities to counter North's threats through US alliance.

13.title: It never fails to impress, thank you Rajamouli sir: Sudeepa on Makkhi
13.article_body: Discussing his film 'Makkhi', which was directed by filmmaker SS Rajamouli, actor Kichcha Sudeepa tweeted, "Very few films, no matter how many times you watch, no matter how old...never fail to impress all over again." "Thank you Rajamouli sir," added Sudeepa in his tweet. "Rajamouli sir narrated Makkhi's plot in less than 10 seconds," Sudeepa had earlier stated.

14.title: Teams are going to reconsider batting approach: Bangar on Bumrah's absence
14.article_body: Ex-India batting coach Sanjay Bangar has said that a lot of teams are going to reconsider their batting approach against India in the absence of Jasprit Bumrah. "So, a huge blow for India, but again, one man's loss is another man's opportunity. Hopefully, Deepak, Shami or Arshdeep can be there and leave a mark on the World Cup," added Bangar.

15.title: To be like Amitabh Bachchan, you need more than just talent: Jaya Prada
15.article_body: Jaya Prada on Amitabh Bachchan's birthday called him "a blessing for the film industry". She said one needs to have "much more than just talent" to be like him. "You need to be dedicated, disciplined and focused like him," the actress said, adding that she's proud and grateful that she got the opportunity to work with him in several films.

16.title: CM Gehlot-led govt is only for 350 more days in Raj: Vasundhara Raje
16.article_body: Former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje on Monday said there are "only 350 days left" for CM Ashok Gehlot-led Congress government in the state. While addressing an event in Churu, Raje said, if one excludes time of Model Code of Conduct, CM Gehlot-led government has less than a year to function before it is voted out of power in Assembly polls.

17.title: Will respond to West's growing involvement in Ukraine conflict: Russia
17.article_body: Russian Deputy Foreign Minister Sergei Ryabkov said Russia will respond to the West's growing involvement in the Ukraine conflict although direct conflict with NATO is not in the country's interests. This comes after the US pledged military aid to Ukraine. "We warn and hope that they realise the danger of uncontrolled escalation in Washington and other Western capitals," Ryabkov added.

18.title: Probably not, I'm out of the race: Mitchell Marsh on Aus' ODI captaincy
18.article_body: Australia all-rounder Mitchell Marsh has ruled himself out of the race for Australia's ODI captaincy, stating, "It's not on my radar at the moment." He added, "Cricket Australia has a decision...it's really not something I've thought about." Australia's white-ball captain Aaron Finch retired from ODIs last month and is likely to announce retirement from T20Is after this year's World Cup.

19.title: E-rickshaw topples due to pothole in UP while officials' convoy passes by; video surfaces
19.article_body: An e-rickshaw toppled and fell on a puddle-filled street in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur district while a convoy of UP officials was passing by. The video of the incident went viral on social media. The accident comes days after Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath directed officials to run a massive campaign for "pothole-free roads" in the state by November 15.

20.title: Man lays electric wire to kill wife, mother-in-law dies instead in MP's Betul: Police
20.article_body: A man laid an electric wire on an iron door to allegedly kill his wife but his mother-in-law came in contact and died instead in Madhya Pradesh's Betul, police said. The wife had gone to her mother's home following a fight, police added. He went to his in-laws' house where he connected the door with a wire, police stated.

21.title: Video shows 3 Chennai students performing stunts with swords on train, arrested
21.article_body: Three students of Presidency College in Chennai have been arrested after they were seen performing stunts with sword-like weapons on a train. Chennai's Divisional Railway Manager took to Twitter to share a video of them performing stunts and confirmed the news of their arrest. "We would like to inform you that we have zero tolerance towards such instances," DRM wrote.

22.title: ICC names 5 emerging players tipped to break out at T20 World Cup 2022
22.article_body: The ICC, on its official website, has named five emerging players tipped to break out at T20 World Cup 2022. The five players are UAE's 20-year-old wicketkeeper-batter Vriitya Aravind, UAE's 21-year-old leg-spinner Karthik Palaniapan Meiyappan, Scotland's 22-year-old all-rounder Brandon McMullen, Netherlands' 22-year-old all-rounder Bas de Leede and Namibia's 19-year-old all-rounder Divan la Cock.

23.title: India to bowl first in ODI series decider, SA make 3 changes to their playing XI
23.article_body: Team India captain Shikhar Dhawan won the toss and elected to bowl first in the ODI series decider against South Africa in Delhi. India have not made any changes to their playing XI, while South Africa have made three changes, with Lungi Ngidi, Andile Phehlukwayo and Marco Jansen replacing Keshav Maharaj, Wayne Parnell and Kagiso Rabada.

24.title: Rajasthan policeman, 2 others gangrape 32-year-old woman in Delhi hotel; arrested
24.article_body: A 34-year-old Rajasthan Police constable and his two friends were arrested for allegedly gangraping a 32-year-old woman in a hotel in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar. According to victim, one of the accused, who knew her, invited her to the hotel, where she was offered a cold drink. She alleged she fell unconscious after consuming the drink and was then sexually assaulted.

25.title: SC issues notice to ED on Satyendar Jain's plea against new judge
25.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday issued a notice to the Enforcement Directorate (ED) over a plea by Delhi minister Satyendar Jain against transferring the money laundering case to a new judge. Delhi High Court had earlier rejected Jain's plea challenging the transfer of the case against him to a new judge. ED arrested Jain in May in the money laundering case.

26.title: Vlogger keeps pillow and sleeps in middle of Dubai road; police shares pic after arrest
26.article_body: The Dubai Police has shared a picture after arresting the vlogger who kept a pillow and slept in the middle of a busy road. "The Asian man endangered his life and the lives of others," the police wrote. The police also urged community members to use the "Police Eye" platform to report such illegal and harmful practices.

27.title: Technology not an agent of exclusion, but inclusion in India: PM
27.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that in India, technology is not an agent of exclusion, but rather an agent of inclusion. PM Modi made the remark while addressing a UN congress via video message. "We have been working on a vision of Antyodaya, which means empowering the last person at the last mile, in a mission mode," he added.

28.title: Panacea Biotec hits upper circuit after ₹1,040-cr vaccine order
28.article_body: A day after Panacea Biotec Limited bagged orders worth ₹1,040 crore from UNICEF and Pan American Health Organization, its shares surged by 20% to hit the upper circuit of ₹160.8 apiece during Tuesday's opening session. The pharmaceutical company will supply its WHO pre-qualified paediatric vaccine, Easyfive-TT. At 11:18 am, its stock was trading 18.25% higher at ₹158.45 apiece on BSE.

29.title: Never imagined I'd work with Sushmita so soon: Ankur Bhatia on 'Taali'
29.article_body: Actor Ankur Bhatia, who featured with Sushmita Sen in the OTT series 'Aarya', said he didn't expect to get "an opportunity to work with her again so soon" in 'Taali'. Bhatia said his character in the film is "very different" and in a space that he hasn't tried before. The actor also described Sushmita as a "supportive and helpful" co-star.

30.title: 2nd Australian Singtel company hit by cyberattack after Optus
30.article_body: Weeks after Optus faced a data breach that compromised the data of up to 10 million customers, Singapore Telecommunications (Singtel) said its unit Dialog has faced a cyberattack in Australia. The attack potentially affected 1,000 current and former employees. The firm said that Dialog's systems are completely independent of Optus. The latest cyberattack was detected on September 10.

31.title: Suzlon Energy stock falls as firm opens ₹1,200-crore rights issue
31.article_body: Suzlon Energy opened its ₹1,200-crore rights issue on Tuesday and its shares were trading lower in the morning trade. The wind power major is offering 240 crore shares for ₹5 per equity share and the rights issue will close on October 20. At 11:55 am, its stock was trading 3.27% lower at ₹7.40 apiece on the BSE.

32.title: Pics of Ujjain’s Mahakal Temple Corridor go viral ahead of its inauguration
32.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first phase of the ₹850-crore Mahakaleshwar Temple Corridor Development Project in Ujjain on Tuesday. The Mahakal Path contains 108 pillars which depict Anand Tandav Swaroop of Lord Shiva. The mural wall along the path is based on Shiva Purana stories such as the act of creation, birth of Ganesh, story of Sati and Daksha.

33.title: VLC Media Player site blocked in India over data transfer to 'hostile country': Report
33.article_body: The IT Ministry ordered the blocking of the VLC Media Player website after it was reportedly found communicating with servers of a previously banned app by the ministry which was transferring sensitive personal data of Indians to a "hostile country". Earlier, VideoLAN, the operator of VLC, had sent a legal notice seeking to know the reason for the same.

34.title: They were close friends, even died together: Families of kids who drowned in Gurugram
34.article_body: The six boys who drowned in a rainwater-filled pit in Gurugram's Sector 111 were a group of close-knit friends who grew up together, played together and even died together, said their family members. "We have been living here for last 15 years, like a close-knit family. The children's bond brought our families closer," said father of one of the deceased.

35.title: Twitter investor sues Musk over 'fraudulent' conduct in buyout deal
35.article_body: A Twitter investor has sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk, alleging that his conduct in regard to Twitter buyout deal was "fraudulent and illegal". Investor Giuseppe Pampena accused Musk of manipulating Twitter's stock price by making statements that created doubt about the $44 billion deal. "Musk hoped to...re-negotiate the buyout price by as much as 25%," the lawsuit alleged.

36.title: WhatsApp working to increase group size to 1,024 people: Report
36.article_body: WhatsApp is testing an update that will allow users to add up to 1,024 participants in a group, WABetaInfo reported. The update has been rolled out to some beta testers, the report added. The messaging app is reportedly also developing tools like a list of pending participants and an approval system to give admins more control over these larger groups.

37.title: Belarus, Russia to deploy joint military group on Belarus' border with Ukraine
37.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko has announced that Belarus and Russia will deploy a joint military task force, local media said. "Ukraine isn't just discussing but planning strikes on the territory of Belarus," Lukashenko reportedly said. "Ukraine doesn't pose a threat...I urge Belarusian military: don't follow criminal orders," Belarusian opposition leader Sviatlana Tsikhanouskaya said.

38.title: Sitharaman to participate in IMF-World Bank meet in US
38.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will leave for the US today to attend a meeting of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) and the World Bank. She will be in the US until October 16. During her visit, she will hold a bilateral meeting with US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen. She is also scheduled to visit the National Science Foundation.

39.title: Death toll from landslide in Venezuela rises to 36; 56 still missing
39.article_body: The death toll following a landslide in Venezuela's Tejerias town has risen to 36, authorities said. At least 56 people are still missing. "We're trying to save whoever we can and are expressing our condolences to all those who have lost a loved one," Venezuelan Vice President Delcy Rodriguez said. President Nicolas Maduro has declared three days of national mourning.

40.title: 3 Class 5 students drown while fishing in pond in Tamil Nadu's Erode
40.article_body: Three children, including an 11-year-old and two 10-year-old boys, drowned while fishing in a pond in Tamil Nadu's Erode district on Monday, said police. The victims studied in Class 5 of the same school. Their parents filed a missing complaint after they didn't return home till 8 pm. The bodies were found after 30 minutes of search in the pond.

41.title: Gym trainer arrested for molesting woman in Mumbai
41.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a gym trainer under Section 354 of the IPC for allegedly molesting a 25-year-old woman. The victim told the police that the accused touched her inappropriately under the pretext of training. According to reports, the 35-year-old accused has been employed at the gym for the past four years.

42.title: Shraddha Kapoor's 'Naagin' trilogy put on hold: Report
42.article_body: Actress Shraddha Kapoor's 'Naagin' trilogy, which was supposed to go on floors in May this year, has been reportedly put on hold due to the "dry spell" in the Hindi film industry. As per a report, the makers might revisit the VFX-heavy film after Shraddha's untitled film with Ranbir Kapoor. The trilogy will feature Shraddha as a shape-shifting serpent.

43.title: Fraudster impersonates a professor, cheats Mumbai man of ₹90,000
43.article_body: A 35-year-old gymnastics coach from Mumbai was cheated of ₹90,000 by a fraudster who texted him on WhatsApp with profile picture of a professor he knew. The fraudster asked him to urgently send her 20 e-gift cards worth ₹5,000 each as she was not carrying her ATM card. Later, the real professor warned people of the fraud through WhatsApp status.

44.title: Delhi Police reach former Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam's home, summon him
44.article_body: Delhi Police on Tuesday reached former Delhi Social Welfare Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam's residence in the national capital and summoned him. Police have asked Gautam to join a probe in connection with a row over a religious conversion event. Gautam has been asked to appear for questioning at 2 pm today.

45.title: 6 of family get buried under sand while collecting it, die in Raj
45.article_body: Six members of a family died after they got buried under sand while collecting it for the repair of their house in Rajasthan's Karauli on Monday, officials said. Four other people were also injured in the incident and are undergoing treatment, a police station in-charge said. The District Collector has promised compensation for the surviving family members.

46.title: Odisha starts preparing for possible cyclones in coming months
46.article_body: The Odisha government has directed officials to start preparing for possible cyclones over the next two months, despite there being no forecast by the weather office. The state faces cyclonic storms in October and November and sometimes even till December 15. State Chief Secretary SC Mohapatra said that this period is considered the "cyclone season" of the state.

47.title: Action taken against 55 Hyd police officials since Dec 2021 for various offences
47.article_body: As many as 55 officials have been punished, which includes being removed from service, for various offences, by Hyderabad Commissioner of Police CV Anand since December 2021. According to data released by police, 22 of the 55 policemen were removed from service, whereas, the Commissioner terminated probation of 15 other personnel. As many as 17 personnel were dismissed from service.

48.title: Video of panther chameleon shared by IFS officer goes viral
48.article_body: An undated video of a panther chameleon shared by an IFS officer has gone viral on social media. Sharing the video on Twitter, IFS officer Susanta Nanda wrote, "Who can be a better painter than God." Reacting to the video, users wrote, "Is it for real? Extremely beautiful!" and, "Nature not God. But yes beautiful, nonetheless."

49.title: 5 men gangrape 15-year-old girl in front of her mother in Jharkhand
49.article_body: As many as five men allegedly gangraped a 15-year-old girl in front of her mother in Jharkhand's Deoghar district, police said. According to the complaint, the accused on two motorcycles stopped them while they were returning from a function and took the girl aside by force and also beat up her mother. Two people have been detained so far.

50.title: Talked to Kanye, expressed my concerns: Musk after Twitter locks rapper's account
50.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said he talked to rapper Kanye West after Twitter locked his account over an anti-Semitic tweet. "Talked to ye (West) today & expressed my concerns about his recent tweet, which I think he took to heart," Musk tweeted. The rapper's account was locked just a day after he returned to Twitter in nearly two years.

51.title: Teen breaks into house in Pune, steals valuables worth ₹2.5 lakh; held
51.article_body: Pune City Police arrested an 18-year-old within a few hours after he stole valuables worth ₹2.5 lakh from a house. The accused broke into the house in Lohiya Nagar and stole ₹2 lakh in cash and some gold ornaments, police said. Police acted on a tip-off and arrested the accused from Ganj Peth, and recovered the stolen cash and gold.

52.title: The legend who inspired me always: Rajinikanth on Amitabh Bachchan's b'day
52.article_body: Rajinikanth wished Amitabh Bachchan on his birthday and called him "the legend" who "always inspired" him. He tweeted, "The one true sensation and superhero of our glorious Indian film fraternity enters 80...happy birthday my dearest and most respected Amitabh ji." Bachchan's daughter Shweta Bachchan, granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda and others also shared their birthday wishes for him.

53.title: Poland checks condition of bomb shelters amid Ukraine war
53.article_body: As Russian invasion of Ukraine continues, Poland's Deputy Interior Minister Maciej Wasik said that Polish fire services are checking the condition of the country's bomb shelters and compiling an inventory. Poland was not under threat, but was preparing for the worst-case scenario, Wasik added. Poland has 62,000 bomb shelters and the process of checking the shelters will last two months.

54.title: There's groundswell of anger against BJP across J&K: Farooq Abdullah
54.article_body: National Conference (NC) President Farooq Abdullah on Monday said that there is a groundswell of anger against BJP across J&K and the people there have made it a point to stand up for their rights. Furthermore, he said that the NC will make every effort to give voice to the aspirations and demands of the people of J&K.

55.title: Traffic block at Pune's Chandani Chowk from 12.30 am to 1 am from today
55.article_body: The traffic on Pune's Chandani Chowk stretch will be stopped for 30 minutes between 12.30 am and 1 am for 8-10 days starting today. The Pune district administration and the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) have taken the decision to carry out rock blasting work for the ongoing construction of the new bridge and service road.

56.title: Mulayam Singh's mortal remains kept at Saifai's Numaish ground; people pay last respects
56.article_body: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's mortal remains have been kept at Numaish ground in Saifai, his ancestral home, for people to pay their last respects. The three-time UP CM's last rites will be performed on Tuesday. The cremation is scheduled to take place around 3 pm. Mulayam Singh passed away aged 82 in Haryana on Monday.

57.title: Mumbai Crime Branch arrests 5 linked to Dawood Ibrahim's D gang
57.article_body: The Anti Extortion Cell of the Mumbai Crime Branch has arrested five people who are associated with the D gang of underworld don Dawood Ibrahim in connection with an extortion case. This comes after the arrest of gangster Salim Fruit, a close aide of gangster Chhota Shakeel and Riyaz Bhati, who in turn are close aides of Dawood.

58.title: Woman on scooter gets run over after being hit by door of car; K'taka govt shares video
58.article_body: Karnataka State Road Safety Authority has shared a video of a woman two-wheeler rider falling and getting run over by a vehicle after being hit by a parked car's door. "Before opening the door of your car on public roads, make sure to check in the side or rear view mirror for vehicles coming from behind," the authority tweeted.

59.title: Political fallout hasn't influenced my relationship with B'wood: Fawad Khan
59.article_body: Pakistani actor Fawad Khan said the "political fallout (between India and Pakistan)" hasn't influenced his relationship with the Hindi film industry. Talking about his Bollywood comeback, Fawad said people who'd like to collaborate with him will "suffer the consequences". He added, "Similarly, if I were to work [in India] and come back (to Pakistan), I'd have to suffer the consequences."

60.title: Told Babar 'Ask Shaheen to bowl yorker at 100 mph' to dismiss Rohit: Raja
60.article_body: Sharing his conversation with Babar Azam regarding the T20 World Cup 2021 match between India and Pakistan, PCB chief Ramiz Raja said, "[I told Babar] I can tell you how to...dismiss Rohit Sharma." "Babar was intrigued. I said, 'Get Shaheen Afridi [to]...bowl...[an] inswinging yorker at 100 mph and don't give Rohit a single...You will get him out'," stated Raja.

61.title: Make this Diwali a happy and healthy Diwali: Oleev
61.article_body: Oleev shared that since cooking oil used in food matters as much as the ingredients, one must make a conscious choice in choosing it, especially during the festive season. Oleev Active is a multisource oil with the goodness of olive oil for Indian cooking, it stated, encouraging customers to choose health, good habits and a proactive lifestyle this Diwali.

62.title: Aaron Finch reprimanded by ICC after stump mic catches him abusing umpire
62.article_body: Australia captain Aaron Finch has been handed an official reprimand for breaching Level 1 of ICC Code of Conduct during the first T20I against England in Perth on Sunday. Finch was caught by the stump mic abusing umpire during a confusion over DRS in the ninth over of England's innings. One demerit point has been added to Finch's disciplinary record.

63.title: My father thought I won't pass, I got around 66% in Class 10 boards: MS Dhoni
63.article_body: Former Team India captain MS Dhoni, at a recent event, said that his father thought he would not pass his Class 10 board exam. Dhoni added, "He [thought] it's gone and that I will have to repeat." Dhoni added that he went on to get around 66% marks. "He was very happy that I passed," Dhoni further said.

64.title: Twitter ordered Zatko to burn notebooks, delete files to destroy evidence: Musk
64.article_body: Elon Musk has accused Twitter officials of ordering whistleblower Peiter Zatko to destroy evidence of their missteps as part of a $7.8 million severance package. Musk's lawyers claimed in a court filing that Zatko burned 10 handwritten notebooks and deleted 100 computer files at the behest of Twitter managers. The documents contained notes of Zatko's meetings with the company's officials.

65.title: Shinde faction submits new symbols 'shining sun', 'shield & sword' to EC
65.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena on Tuesday submitted new party symbols 'shining sun', 'shield & sword' and 'peepul tree' as its election symbol options to Election Commission of India (ECI). The new symbols were submitted days after EC's order of freezing Shiv Sena's name and election symbol. Shiv Sena's Uddhav Thackeray faction was allotted 'flaming torch' as their election symbol.

66.title: Crypto firm Coinbase gets Singapore licence for payment services
66.article_body: Coinbase, the US' largest cryptocurrency exchange, received approval from Singapore's central bank to offer payment services in the city. Coinbase called it a "significant milestone" and said it has been building up its presence in Singapore and currently had nearly 100 employees there. About 180 crypto firms applied for payment licences in Singapore and 17 have received in-principle approvals.

67.title: Axar Patel can do it: Chahal on Ravindra Jadeja's alternative for T20 WC
67.article_body: India spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has backed Axar Patel to do the job for the team in all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's absence in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "No one can take Jadeja's place. But the way Axar has been bowling, we've found one alternative...he can do it," stated Chahal. Axar has picked a total of 10 wickets in last six T20Is.

68.title: No data compromise proof found from cyberattack: Lloyd's of London
68.article_body: Insurance company Lloyd's of London, which was investigating a possible cyberattack, said on Monday that it had found no evidence of data compromise. "Lloyd's has been advised that its network services can now be restored," the company said. The firm had detected "an unusual activity on its network" as companies are on high alert for intrusions due to Russia-Ukraine conflict.

69.title: Iran adds centrifuges banned under 2015 nuke deal to underground plant: Report
69.article_body: Iran has brought advanced centrifuges at its underground plant at Natanz, Reuters said citing a confidential report by the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA). The 2015 nuclear deal banned Iran from adding these advanced centrifuges to enrich uranium. The indirect talks between Iran and the United States on reviving the 2015 nuclear deal have been stalled.

70.title: Musk's Starlink in talks with DoT for satellite communication services in India: Report
70.article_body: Elon Musk's Starlink is reportedly in talks with the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) for a  licence to deliver satellite-based communication services in India. To provide this service, companies need to get Global Mobile Personal Communication by Satellite (GMPCS) licence from the government. The report while quoting sources said that Starlink is likely to apply for the same within a month.

71.title: Big B surprises fans waiting outside his home at midnight for his birthday
71.article_body: A video showing Amitabh Bachchan surprising fans waiting outside his home at midnight for his 80th birthday has surfaced online. The video also shows fans hugging each other in joy, upon Bachchan's arrival. The actor stepped out of his bungalow along with his daughter Shweta Bachchan Nanda and granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda.

72.title: Chief Justices of Rajasthan, Karnataka, J&K and Ladakh HCs named
72.article_body: The central government has notified the transfer of Justice Pankaj Mithal to Rajasthan High Court as the Chief Justice. Justice PB Varale has been appointed as the Chief Justice of Karnataka High Court, while Justice AM Magrey as the Chief Justice of J&K and Ladakh High Court, tweeted Union Minister Kiren Rijiju.

73.title: Big B's Israeli fan says he's learnt Hindi only by listening to his dialogues
73.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan's fan from Israel, Moses Sapir, said he has learnt to speak Hindi only by listening to the actor's dialogues. "I have seen most of [his] films more than 200 times...films like 'Silsila' and 'Main Azaad Hoon' were a bit tough for me to understand during my childhood...watching these films repeatedly made me become extremely fond," he added.

74.title: Congress came to power in Raj due to strength of party workers: Pilot
74.article_body: Congress leader Sachin Pilot on Monday said that the Congress came to power in Rajasthan in 2018 because of the strength of its workers who had struggled for five years. Furthermore, he said that party workers and leaders are working collectively to ensure the party's victory in the 2023 Assembly polls.

75.title: TSRTC's new facility to allow people to track 3,800 buses in real-time
75.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC)  has created a new facility that will allow passengers to track buses in real-time. This facility will allow passengers to track 3,800 buses in real-time. Reports said that the authorities have installed a tracking device in buses for this purpose. Passengers will be able to see arrival and departure times too.

76.title: Yati Narsinghanand gets bail in case linked to Muzaffarnagar riots
76.article_body: Ghaziabad's Dasna Devi temple priest Yati Narsinghanand was released on bail after he surrendered before a court in Uttar Pradesh in a case linked to 2013 Muzaffarnagar riots. According to Prosecution Officer Niraj Singh, Narsinghanand is among the 21 accused, including Union Minister Sanjeev Balyan, facing charges of violating prohibitory orders and inciting communal violence.

77.title: No legal basis to act on Russian superyacht: Hong Kong leader
77.article_body: Hong Kong leader John Lee said the city has "no legal basis" to act on a luxury yacht belonging to sanctioned Russian oligarch Alexey Mordashov. "We'll [only] comply with UN sanctions," Lee added. Mordashov was sanctioned by the European Union and US, but not the UN after Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The yacht docked in Hong Kong waters last week.

78.title: CJI UU Lalit recommends Justice DY Chandrachud as his successor
78.article_body: Chief Justice of India UU Lalit has recommended the name of Justice DY Chandrachud as his successor. Justice UU Lalit, who took oath as the Chief Justice on August 27, is set to retire on November 8 this year. The appointment of Justice DY Chandrachud will make him the 50th Chief Justice of India.

79.title: Flew Smith to Perth to make him 12th man, that's not right: Michael Clarke
79.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke has criticised the Australian management for not including Steve Smith in their playing XI for the first England T20I. "Flew Smith to Perth to make him 12th man, that's not right," stated Clarke. On Australia's batting order for the T20 WC, Clarke added, "If Smith [is batting at four], you've got to give him some cricket."

80.title: NCP, Shiv Sena, SP to take part in Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra
80.article_body: As the Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra is set to reach Maharashtra on November 9, NCP, Shiv Sena, SP and other like-minded parties will be taking part in the campaign. "The BJP government at the Centre has made the future of citizens dark. The BJP wants to eliminate other parties through non-parliamentary means," said Congress leader Nana Patole.

81.title: NIA conducts raids at multiple locations in J&K in terror funding case
81.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday carried out raids at multiple locations in Jammu and Kashmir in a terror funding case. The searches were conducted at locations in the districts of Rajouri, Poonch, Jammu, Srinagar, Pulwama, Budgam, Shopian and Bandipora. The case is related to the suspicious activities of Al Huda Educational Trust in J&K's Rajouri, as per reports.

82.title: TCS to give 100% variable pay to 70% of employees for Q2 FY23
82.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) will give 100% variable pay to 70% of its employees for the second quarter of FY23. "The remaining 30% of employees will be paid...based on the business unit performance," Chief Human Resources Officer Milind Lakkad said. In August, TCS said it hadn't delayed variable payout for Q1 and it was fully paid out to all employees.

83.title: Thai PM orders tighter gun rules after mass shooting killed 36 people
83.article_body: After an ex-policeman killed 36 people including 24 children in Thailand, Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha ordered authorities to revoke the gun licences of registered owners who have reportedly behaved in a way that "threatens society". He has also ordered search and test for the use of illicit drugs among officials. Regular mental checks will be reportedly required for gun licence.

84.title: Deepika Padukone meets & interacts with mental health patients, shares pics
84.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone and her mental health foundation Live Love Laugh's team interacted with mental health patients and their caregivers in rural areas of Tamil Nadu's Thiruvallur. Sharing pictures of her visit on Instagram, Deepika wrote, "Since our inception, we have been relentless in our efforts to improve the lives of those experiencing mental illness, as well as...their caregivers."

85.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra will bring back democracy in country: Cong's Mallu Ravi
85.article_body: Congress leader Mallu Ravi praised Rahul Gandhi for the Bharat Jodo Yatra, saying the campaign will restore the country's Constitution and democracy. "There is no freedom of speech and no freedom to question the government. Rahul Gandhi raised this issue in Parliament as there is no change in the attitude of the Centre and the TRS government," said Ravi.

86.title: Man pays woman to teach in his place at school in Gurugram; 3 held
86.article_body: A man who allegedly hired a woman to teach at a school in his place in Gurugram's Sector 54 was arrested by the CM's flying squad on Monday. The woman and the school headmaster were also arrested. The man, who did all this in connivance with the headmaster, used to pay the woman ₹8,000/month, DSP of CM's flying squad said.

87.title: It was very emotional: Abhishek on surprising Amitabh Bachchan on 'KBC 14'
87.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan said it was "very emotional" for him to be able to surprise Amitabh Bachchan and celebrate his 80th birthday on the sets of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 14'. "It took a lot of secrecy, a lot of planning, hard work, and a lot of rehearsals to get it right. But then again, he deserves no less," Abhishek said.

88.title: Infosys to consider share buyback proposal on Thursday
88.article_body: Infosys will consider a proposal for a share buyback on Thursday. The IT major expects the buyback to be valued between ₹8,700 crore and ₹9,500 crore. Infosys completed its last share buyback of ₹9,200 crore in September 2021 and a one-year gap is a must between two buybacks. As of June end, its cash and equivalents were at ₹13,982 crore.

89.title: Delhi witnesses cleanest air day with AQI at 44 since August 2020
89.article_body: Delhi on Monday, with an air quality index (AQI) of 44 amid rains, witnessed its cleanest day in terms of air quality since August 2020. This comes a day after the national capital's AQI stood at 48 on Sunday. Delhi's AQI on August 31, 2020, was 41. "Once rains go away, AQI will once again start rising," an official said.

90.title: Bengaluru doctor's murder was preplanned, partner was having an affair: Police
90.article_body: A 27-year-old woman architect who was arrested last month in connection with the murder of her live-in partner, a Bengaluru-based doctor, had preplanned it, police said. "Our investigation revealed that she was having an affair with one of the accused," said police. The woman had alleged that she murdered the doctor after he uploaded her nude photographs and videos online.

91.title: B'luru autorickshaw drivers protest against ban on Ola, Uber, Rapido
91.article_body: Auto-rickshaw drivers in Bengaluru staged a protest outside a Regional Transport Office (RTO) on Monday against the government's order banning ride-hailing platforms Ola, Uber and Rapido. The drivers parked their vehicles and raised slogans against the ban. Notably, the Karnataka Transport Department has penalised some drivers associated with the ride-hailing platforms in the city.

92.title: Customer giving false info that I delayed order: Zomato agent in viral 'aarti' video
92.article_body: A Zomato delivery agent took to Twitter after a video of him being welcomed with an 'aarti' by a customer in Delhi went viral. The agent while sharing a screenshot of the order details, wrote, that through the video, the customer was spreading false information that he delayed their order. Commenting on his tweet, Zomato sought further details from him.

93.title: Streamer breaks her back after jumping into foam pit at TwitchCon in US, video surfaces
93.article_body: Streamer Adriana Chechik broke her back in two places after jumping into a foam pit at the TwitchCon gaming convention in US. A video of the incident surfaced on social media, where Chechik could be heard saying "I can't get up" after landing on the pit. Chechik said she's getting a "surgery to put a meter rod in for support".

94.title: India reports 1,957 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 27,374
94.article_body: India reported 1,957 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 2,654 people recovered in the last 24 hours, following which active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 27,374. The recovery rate in the country currently stands at 98.75%, while the daily positivity rate is at 0.71%.

95.title: I don't know: Dhanush's father on reports about actor calling off divorce with Aishwaryaa
95.article_body: Reacting to reports claiming that Dhanush and Aishwaryaa Rajinikanth are calling off their divorce, the actor's father said, "I don't know. My wife and I can live a good life even without the support of our children. The only expectation we have is for them to be happy." "We are happy when they are happy," he further said.

96.title: People are not going to tolerate an India where youths don’t have jobs: Rahul
96.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said the people of the country are not going to tolerate an India where millions of youngsters are without jobs. Furthermore, he added, "We are not going to tolerate an India where the vast majority of our people, millions and millions of people, are drowning under the weight of rising prices."

97.title: Pune police shares video of constable singing song 'Desh Mere'
97.article_body: Pune City Police on Monday shared a video of its constable Sagar Ghorpade singing the song 'Desh Mere' on Twitter, saying that there is "no need for a special day" to dedicate a song to the country. The song is from the movie 'Bhuj: The Pride of India'. A Twitter user reacted to the video, saying, "That's very beautiful."

98.title: Quitters never win, winners never quit: Vivek Agnihotri after Karan Johar quits Twitter
98.article_body: After Karan Johar announced that he's quitting Twitter and deleted his account, filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri tweeted, "Quitters never win. Winners never quit." "I believe a genuine person seeking positive energies would leave Social Media completely. Leaving only Twitter because it doesn't allow hypocrisy or fakeness but staying on Instagram...is a negative and screwed up approach to life," he added.

99.title: Amitabh Bachchan isn't just a masterclass in acting, he's a feeling: Johar
99.article_body: Karan Johar on Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday said that the actor isn’t just a legend or a masterclass in acting, but a feeling "that trained minds to what a hero in cinema is and must always be". He called Amitabh a feeling "that defines cinema memories". "There'll be artists, megastars, celluloid masters...but there'll never be another Amitabh Bachchan," Johar added.

100.title: Boundaries are close to 30-yard circle in India, they're far bigger in Aus: Ashwin
100.article_body: India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin, on being asked about India's bowling concerns, said, "It's only fair to say the bowlers are getting hit around the park but we also need to understand the boundaries are very close to the 30-yard circle in India." He added, "[In] Australia, boundaries are far bigger, gives the bowlers a bit of licence to work with."

101.title: Vij recommends 3 officials' suspension during surprise inspection in Ambala
101.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij conducted a surprise inspection of a municipal council in Ambala on Monday and recommended the suspension of three officials over non-redressal of complaints. Vij also cross-checked the complaints with the applicants before taking action. At first, Vij inspected the room of the executive officer and then the record files at his private assistant's office.

102.title: Silicon Valley's wealthiest Russian Yuri Milner renounces citizenship amid war
102.article_body: Amid the ongoing war with Ukraine, Silicon Valley's richest Russian Yuri Milner said that he has renounced his citizenship after leaving the country in 2014. "My family and I left Russia for good in 2014," tweeted the billionaire. He's the founder of the internet investment firm DST Global. The Bloomberg Billionaires Index estimates Milner's wealth at about $3.5 billion.

103.title: Ukraine puts ex-Russian President Dmitry Medvedev on wanted list
103.article_body: Ukraine's Security Service (SBU) on Monday said ex-Russian President Dmitry Medvedev is on the country's wanted list. Medvedev, now Deputy Chairman of Russia's Security Council, is wanted under a section of the criminal code dealing with attempts to undermine Ukraine's territorial integrity and inviolability of its borders, the SBU added, saying, he was put on the list in March 2022.

104.title: Delhi Metro revises timings to facilitate India vs South Africa match spectators
104.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) has decided to extend the last train timings today by 30-45 minutes on all its lines by providing an additional 48 trips to facilitate the spectators of cricket match between India and South Africa. The metro stations closest to the stadium are Delhi Gate metro station and ITO metro station, both on Violet Line.

105.title: Woman jumps into well with her 3 children in Bihar, all die
105.article_body: A woman and her three children, aged between three and eight, died after she allegedly jumped into a well along with them in Bihar's Kaimur, police said on Monday. The bodies of the woman and children were recovered after slippers worn by the children were found floating inside the well, according to an SHO. The woman's husband has been detained.

106.title: 1 dead, 1 rescued after being stuck on track on Kedarnath-Ransi trek
106.article_body: One person died while the other was rescued after the two were stuck on track during the Kedarnath-Ransi trek. The two had come to the trek as part of a group of 10 people, reports said. An SDRF spokesperson said that the tourists were found almost 6 km from Kedarnath, under heavy snowfall and harsh conditions.

107.title: Pawar to welcome Cong's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maharashtra: Reports
107.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar and his daughter Supriya Sule are likely to welcome Congress MP Rahul Gandhi when the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra campaign reaches Maharashtra on November 9. One of the NCP leaders said that Pawar's participation would send a message that the Opposition is united. The yatra was started on September 7 and has completed over 500 km.

108.title: 6 injured in clash over loud music near mosque in UP's Sultanpur
108.article_body: At least six persons, including a policeman, were injured following a clash between two communities over loud music near a mosque in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur, police said. The incident took place during a Durga Puja immersion procession in the Baldirai area when it was passing at the time of 'azaan' from near a mosque, police added.

109.title: Jailed J&K separatist leader Altaf Ahmad Shah dies at AIIMS Delhi
109.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Altaf Ahmad Shah, jailed in an alleged terror funding case, died of cancer aged 66 at AIIMS, New Delhi on Tuesday. Shah, son-in-law of late Hurriyat leader Syed Ali Shah Geelani, was shifted to AIIMS following a Delhi High Court order. "Abu breathed his last at AIIMS, New Delhi. As a prisoner," Ruwa Shah, Altaf's daughter said.

110.title: We’ll take 'mashaal' to every home: Aaditya Thackeray on new poll symbol
110.article_body: After the Election Commission allotted the 'flaming torch' symbol to ex-Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray’s faction, former state minister Aaditya Thackeray said that they will take the "mashaal" symbol to every home. "The new symbol, new name…we are extremely proud of Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray. He has worked as a CM, saving thousands of lives in Maharashtra," Aaditya said.

111.title: Man who threatened Ambani is frustrated about inflation, suffers from schizophrenia: Lawyer
111.article_body: Rakesh Kumar Mishra, a 30-year-old man from Bihar, who was arrested for threatening to kill industrialist Mukesh Ambani and his family, is mentally disturbed and has been suffering from chronic schizophrenia, his lawyer told the court. "He was frustrated about rising inflation and believed that the central government was favouring Reliance, hence he made threat calls to them," she added.

112.title: Was 13 when parents went through divorce; became difficult: 'Sacred...' actress
112.article_body: 'Sacred Games' actress Elnaaz Norouzi said that she was 13 when her parents were going through a divorce. "It became too difficult to deal with it on my own and so...I went for counselling and things became better. I went to the therapist for a very, very long time," she said, adding that she speaks to her therapist when needed.

113.title: Pune-based CA trying to book Goa hotel online cheated of ₹94,000
113.article_body: A 30-year-old CA professional from Pune was cheated of ₹94,000 while trying to book a hotel room in Goa online, said police. According to the victim, he dialled a number he found on a search engine and paid ₹25,000 as an initial booking amount. He was then asked to make additional payment to get the receipt.

114.title: India's Oscar entry Chhello Show's child actor Rahul Koli dies of cancer
114.article_body: Child actor Rahul Koli, who was a part of India's official Oscars 2023 entry 'Chhello Show', passed away earlier this month after battling leukaemia. Rahul's father Ramu Koli, who drives an auto-rickshaw for a living, said his son was looking forward to the film's release on October 14. "But he left us before that," Ramu added.

115.title: Raj Bhavan illuminated in pink light to spread breast cancer awareness in Hyd
115.article_body: Raj Bhavan was illuminated in pink light to spread breast cancer awareness in Hyderabad on Monday. Reports said that this is the third consecutive year that the Raj Bhavan has been illuminated. It is an initiative of the Ushalakshmi Breast Cancer Foundation headed by breast cancer surgeon, Dr P Raghu Ram, reports added.

116.title: Mandhana shares tips with Thailand Women after her 100th T20I game
116.article_body: India Women batter Smriti Mandhana was seen sharing batting tips with Thailand Women after their match in the ongoing Women's Asia Cup 2022. Notably, it was Mandhana's 100th T20I game and she's now only the second Indian woman cricketer to achieve the feat. In the game, India bundled out Thailand for just 37 runs and won by nine wickets.

117.title: Traffic restrictions in Delhi due to India vs South Africa ODI match today
117.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police imposed some traffic restrictions and diversions in view of the One Day International (ODI) cricket match between India and South Africa today at the Arun Jaitley Stadium. The police also advised travellers going to the Indira Gandhi International airport, Old Delhi and Nizamuddin railway stations, as well as ISBT to leave early to avoid delays.

118.title: Man stabs his estranged wife twice in Mumbai's Churchgate, arrested
118.article_body: The Churchgate Government Railway Police (GRP) have arrested a 39-year-old man for allegedly stabbing his estranged wife twice at the railway station in Mumbai. The woman has been admitted to Gokuldas Tejpal Hospital and her condition is reported to be critical. The accused is a welder by profession and stays in Palghar.

119.title: You're not doing any charity: SC to Raj govt over COVID ex-gratia compensation
119.article_body: Supreme Court told the Rajasthan government that it is not doing any charity after it filed its affidavit on steps to pay ex-gratia compensation to family members of COVID-19 victims. "Affidavit filed by Rajasthan government isn't satisfactory at all," SC added. It has been alleged that the Rajasthan government is not adhering to the 2021 order over COVID-19 ex-gratia compensation.

120.title: PayPal recalls policy to fine customers for misinformation after facing criticism
120.article_body: PayPal on Monday withdrew one of its policy updates that stated customers could be fined $2,500 for spreading misinformation, after facing criticism over it. The company apologised for it and said the policy update "went out in error that included incorrect information." Shares of the company were nearly 6% down after the update.

121.title: Love how she speaks her heart: Sushmita on Shreegauri Sawant
121.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen said she loves how transgender activist Shreegauri Sawant speaks her heart with "open, inclusive, aware, audacious and awe-inspiring clarity". Sushmita will be playing the lead role in the upcoming Shreegauri Sawant biopic, which is titled 'Taali'. "It's time to break barriers," Sushmita said, adding, "Here's to leaving our world less divided and an existence more united."

122.title: Army dog fights terrorists even after being shot twice in J&K; pic goes viral
122.article_body: An Army assault dog was on Monday critically injured during an encounter between security forces and terrorists in Anantnag district of Jammu and Kashmir, officials said. Army sent the dog named Zoom inside the house where the terrorists were holed up, officials added. Even after being shot twice, Zoom continued the task which resulted in neutralisation of two terrorists.

123.title: Germany to deliver air defence system to Ukraine 'within days'
123.article_body: Germany will deliver the first of four IRIS-T SLM air defence systems to Ukraine "within days", German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said. "The renewed missile fire on Kyiv and...other cities show how important it is to supply Ukraine with air defence systems quickly," Lambrecht added. "Russia's attacks with missiles and drones terrorise above all the civilian population," she further said.

124.title: Rajinikanth called Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather' very interesting: Director
124.article_body: Director Mohan Raja shared that Rajinikanth watched 'GodFather' and found it "excellent" and "very interesting". The director described the praise from Rajinikanth as "one of the best moments" of his life. 'GodFather', starring Chiranjeevi and Nayanthara, is the Telugu remake of the Malayalam film 'Lucifer'. The original film starred Mohanlal in the lead role.

125.title: Pune's first underground metro station to be ready by November
125.article_body: The first underground metro station in Pune, being built at Shivajinagar, is 85% complete and will be ready by November, said Brijesh Dixit, MD of Maha Metro. However, it will be operational only after it gets clearance from the railway safety department, he added. The Pimpri Chinchwad to Swargate route will be underground from Shivajinagar to Swargate.

126.title: Over 60% complaints on Dial 112 from high-rise societies in GB Nagar
126.article_body: Over 60% of complaints on Dial 112 on a monthly average are from high-rise housing societies in Gautam Buddha Nagar, said officials. Maximum complaints from high-rise societies are of ruckus and fights between two groups, Dial 112 in-charge said. The helpline on an average gets over 550 complaints daily and over 17,000 complaints in a month, according to the data.

127.title: She's a miracle baby: Parineeti on Priyanka Chopra's daughter Malti
127.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra called her niece and Priyanka Chopra's daughter Malti Marie Chopra Jonas "a miracle baby". "She is so cute [that] I want to eat her...She is just a miracle baby. The most beautiful and the sweetest baby," Parineeti said, who is currently promoting 'Code Name: Tiranga'. Priyanka and Nick Jonas welcomed Malti via surrogacy in January 2022.

128.title: Dhawan is playing in a laid back manner, needs to show intent: Jaffer
128.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said Shikhar Dhawan batted in a "laid back" manner during the two ODIs played so far against South Africa. "When we saw Dhawan in his purple patch, it looked like he played aggressively from the outset...Dhawan has to regain that intent," added Jaffer. Dhawan has scored 17 runs in the ongoing ODI series so far.

129.title: Huge crowd gathers at Mulayam Singh’s ancestral home in Saifai to pay tributes
129.article_body: People turned out in large numbers to pay their tributes to Samajwadi Party founder and former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav at his ancestral home in UP’s Saifai on Tuesday. Yadav’s last rites will be held today in Saifai at 3 pm. He passed away on Monday after undergoing treatment at Gurugram’s Medanta Hospital for a few days.

130.title: Delhi govt launches app to keep track of ongoing, upcoming projects
130.article_body: Delhi government has launched an app called 'Delhi E-Monitoring' to keep a track of all the ongoing and upcoming projects. "App has been launched for monitoring of projects/inspection/tasks [and will be] used by ministers and senior officers of all departments of Delhi government," a Public Works Department (PWD) official said. All departments have been asked to update data, officials said.

131.title: TMC MLA Manik Bhattacharya arrested by ED in teacher recruitment scam
131.article_body: Trinamool Congress MLA Manik Bhattacharya has been arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in the teacher recruitment scam. He is the second TMC MLA to be arrested in the recruitment scam after Partha Chatterjee. Bhattacharya is the former Chairman of the state primary education board. He was removed from his post by the Calcutta High Court in June.

132.title: Google removes ad-free Instagram clone 'The OG App' from Play Store
132.article_body: Google has removed 'The OG App' from the Play Store, over a week after Apple pulled it down from the App Store. The app offered users an ad-free and suggestion-free Instagram feed, with an option to turn off Reels. "OG will be unable to continue serving users through...mobile app," the app's co-founders said after the removal.

133.title: She was 1st girl in family in long: 4-yr-old Delhi mishap victim's uncle
133.article_body: The uncle of the four-year-old girl who died after a building collapsed near Lahori Gate in Delhi, said that she was the first girl in the family in a long time. "Among us seven brothers, only he (girl's father) had a daughter. We were planning to celebrate her birthday next month," he said, adding their family has been badly affected.

134.title: Pune woman downloads electricity bill payment 'app', loses ₹7.66 lakh
134.article_body: A 65-year-old woman from Pune lost ₹7.66 lakh from her account as online fraudsters asked her to pay her electricity bill after making her download the "Electricity Quick support" application on her cell phone, police said. The victim claimed that she received a call from someone claiming to be an employee of Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited.

135.title: Won't share Nord Stream investigation findings with Russia: Sweden
135.article_body: Swedish PM Magdalena Andersson has said that Sweden won't share the findings of its probe into the explosions of Nord Stream 1 and 2 gas pipelines with Russia. Last week, Russian PM Mikhail Mishustin sent a letter to the Swedish government requesting that Russian authorities and the company Gazprom be involved in the Swedish investigation. Sweden had denied the request.

136.title: Hate speeches sullying India's atmosphere, need to be curbed: Supreme Court
136.article_body: Supreme Court has told a PIL petitioner who raised the issue of "governmental inaction" over "hate speeches" that she may be right in saying that hate speeches are sullying the country's atmosphere and need to be curbed. The CJI , however, said that the plea lacked specifics or detailed information and had only "vague" assertions.

137.title: Nayanthara, Vignesh Shivan accused of breaking surrogacy laws; TN govt to probe
137.article_body: After actress Nayanthara and filmmaker Vignesh Shivan announced birth of twin sons, Tamil Nadu Minister Ma Subramanian said the state government will investigate the allegations that the couple violated surrogacy rules. "According to norms, those aged 21 years and under the age of 36 can donate oocytes. We presume this could have been done that way," the minister said.

138.title: Bodies of 2 B'luru mountaineers killed in U'khand avalanche found
138.article_body: The bodies of two mountaineers from Bengaluru who were killed in the recent avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district have been recovered, said officials. The victims were identified as 26-year-old Rakshith K and 33-year-old Vikram M. They were returning after completing a 28-day advanced mountaineering course at Uttarkashi-based Nehru Institute of Mountaineering.

139.title: India votes to reject Russia's demand for secret vote on Ukraine
139.article_body: India voted to reject Russia's demand to hold a secret vote in the UN General Assembly on whether to condemn Moscow's move to annex four partially occupied regions in Ukraine. India and over 100 other nations voted in favour of a recorded vote. Only 13 countries opposed holding a public vote.

140.title: Madonna appears to come out as gay at 64 in TikTok video
140.article_body: Singer Madonna seemingly came out as gay in a video posted on TikTok. In the video, the 64-year-old apparently holds a pair of pink panties with the caption on video stating, "If I miss...I'm gay." She then tosses the underwear towards a waste basket, intentionally misses and then gestures, "Oh well". “What in the 80s is happening?" a fan commented.

141.title: A bankruptcy moment: Zoho CEO on Bernanke winning Economics Nobel
141.article_body: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu called Ben Bernanke's Nobel Prize in Economic Sciences a "bankruptcy moment for central banking". The former US Federal Reserve Chair was awarded the Nobel for research on banks and financial crises. "Bernanke wins...at the very moment when...global financial system is...on the edge due to...misguided monetary policies he and other central bankers spearheaded," Vembu said.

142.title: Mumbai airport makes 100% switch to green energy sources
142.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) has entirely switched to green sources for its energy consumption needs, making it one of India's 100% sustainable airports, a CSMIA official said. Out of its total 100% needs, the airport procures around 5% of electricity requirement through solar energy and 95% from other green sources such as hydro and wind energy.

143.title: Delhi waives late payment fees on outstanding water bills till Dec 31
143.article_body: Delhi government will waive late payment fees on outstanding water bills till December 31, CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Monday. "You can pay your old outstanding bills without worrying about late fees," he tweeted. "To clean the Yamuna, three important projects approved today...55 MGD sewage pumping stations will be built on Badli, Nigam Bodh and Mori Gate drains," Kejriwal added.

144.title: Data Science recruiters don't look at your degree or experience: Scaler
144.article_body: To understand what companies are looking for when hiring data science professionals, Scaler interviewed 100+ data scientists from 50+ product tech companies. They're now consolidating the insights they gathered together in a free live class, it stated. People from a non-coding background looking to transition into the field of data science are welcome to attend this free class, Scaler added.

145.title: Dearness allowance for Jharkhand govt employees hiked to 38%
145.article_body: The Jharkhand cabinet on Monday approved a 4% hike in dearness allowance (DA) for state government employees and in dearness relief (DR) for its pensioners with effect from July 1 this year. DA for state government employees has been hiked from the existing 34% to 38%, an official said. Likewise, DR for pensioners has been hiked to 38%, she added.

146.title: Karnataka logs 109 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death
146.article_body: Karnataka reported 109 new cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 3.96% in the last 24 hours, the health department informed on Monday. Out of the fresh cases, 63 were logged in the Bengaluru Urban district, as per the daily COVID-19 bulletin. The lone fatality due to the infection in the state was recorded in the Uttara Kannada district.

147.title: Ishant relishing extra mentorship responsibilities: Delhi head coach
147.article_body: Delhi head coach Abhay Sharma said India bowler Ishant Sharma is relishing the extra responsibility of mentoring young pacers in the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy. "He can read the conditions better than anyone and...is sharing his knowledge...which is a very good sign for the team," said Abhay. He added that the team has put "ownership" responsibilities on senior players.

148.title: Brighton's 24-year-old midfielder Mwepu retires due to heart issue
148.article_body: Brighton's 24-year-old midfielder from Zambia, Enock Mwepu, has retired from football after being diagnosed with a hereditary heart condition. Brighton said Mwepu's condition wasn't previously evident on regular cardiac screening. Mwepu fell ill during the recent international break and after being admitted to a hospital in Mali, returned to Brighton for further tests which revealed his condition.

149.title: Qatar hires 3rd cruise ship to serve as fan hotel during FIFA World Cup
149.article_body: The FIFA World Cup organisers in Qatar have hired a third cruise ship to operate as a soccer fan hotel docked at Doha Port. Qatar does not have the hotel capacity for all those who will participate in the tournament and is coming up with solutions to deal with the same. The 1,075-cabin cruise will be available from November 19.

150.title: Hard to score against us in FIFA World Cup: India U-17 Women's head coach
150.article_body: India U-17 Women's head coach Thomas Dennerby said the team is hard to score against if it can execute its game plan properly. "If we utilise the chances we create, we can come out with points," said Dennerby. India will begin their FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup campaign against the USA at the Kalinga Stadium in Bhubaneswar on Tuesday.

151.title: La Nina caused excess rainfall in India in September: Report
151.article_body: Between June 1 and September 30, India recorded 925 mm of rain against the normal of 870 mm and above-average rainfall was reported for the fourth consecutive year. According to a report, the increased rainfall can be attributed to the La Nina conditions across the Pacific Ocean. Despite the majority of India recording excessive rains, 187 districts reported deficit rainfall.

152.title: Expect trade with India to cross $100 billion in 2 to 3 years: UAE
152.article_body: UAE's foreign trade minister Thani Bin Ahmed Al Zeyoudi said the UAE expects trade with India to cross $100 billion following the comprehensive economic partnership agreement signed in May 2022. The Indo-UAE trade stood at $73 billion, growing by 68% from last year. The total value of non-oil trade stood at $29.5 billion in first half of 2022.

153.title: Justices Chandrachud, Nazeer object to SC judges' selection process
153.article_body: Supreme Court judges Justices DY Chandrachud and Abdul Nazeer objected to the process of selection and appointment of judges by seeking views through the circulation of letters. Following this, the collegium headed by CJI UU Lalit aborted the process. Currently, there are five vacancies of judges in the apex court. The two judges didn't disclose any views about the candidates.

154.title: Blinken speaks to Azeri prez, welcomes release of Armenian POWs
154.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken on Monday spoke with Azeri President Ilham Aliyev about the "positive steps" Azerbaijan and Armenia are taking towards reaching a "sustainable peace agreement", a State Department readout said. Blinken also welcomed the release of 17 Armenian prisoners of war (POWs), the readout added. Armed fighting between the two countries last month killed over 200 people.

155.title: Indian space economy to reach $13 bn by 2025: Report
155.article_body: India's space economy is expected to be worth nearly $13 billion by 2025, according to a report released by the Indian Space Association (ISpA) and Ernst and Young. The satellite launch services segment will witness the highest growth due to government allowing participation of private players, the report added. In 2020, India's space economy was pegged at $9.6 billion.

156.title: Having skills without degree will be enough in the future: PM Modi
156.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, while inaugurating an educational complex near Ahmedabad, said that only those societies that focus on education will succeed. "At the same time, I want to stress the importance of skill development as well. In the future, if a student does not have a degree but has some skill then it will be enough," the PM added.

157.title: Matthew Wade was out under the laws of cricket: Brad Hogg
157.article_body: Reacting to Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade pushing England pacer Mark Wood while the latter was going for a catch, ex-spinner Brad Hogg said that Wade was out under the laws of cricket. "[Jos] Buttler [was] put under extreme pressure to appeal...Umpires should be given the power to step in and make a correct decision in this situation," Hogg said.

158.title: Protests erupt over alleged RSS training in Coimbatore govt school
158.article_body: The Coimbatore Corporation Commissioner ordered an inquiry after activists protested in front of a government school alleging that RSS 'training' was organised there. The civic body said it had not given any permission for a meeting or training as activists shouted slogans. The RSS also reportedly denied holding any training in the school.

159.title: Akshay saved me from twisting my already injured leg: Juhi on 'Mr & Mrs Khiladi'
159.article_body: On the 25th anniversary of 'Mr & Mrs Khiladi', Juhi Chawla shared an anecdote from the shoot where Akshay Kumar saved her from twisting her already injured leg. "I'd...broken ligament," she wrote, adding, "Once while shooting...song 'Hum Total Fida Tumpe'...I slipped on...wet grass, and in a flash...Akshay was down beside me and saved me from twisting my leg again."

160.title: Deepika meets patients from TN village to mark World Mental Health Day
160.article_body: Deepika Padukone shared a post on Instagram marking World Mental Health Day. Ahead of the occasion, she visited rural areas in Tamil Nadu's Tiruvallur, where she interacted with beneficiaries, as well as their caregivers from her 'The Live Love Laugh Foundation'. "Expanding our rural outreach program is one...more important step towards making mental health care accessible...for all," she wrote.

161.title: India to emerge as hub of AI across the world: Piyush Goyal
161.article_body: Union Minister of Commerce and Industry Piyush Goyal said that India is going to emerge as the hub of the artificial intelligence (AI) revolution across the world. He stated that government initiatives like Open Network for Digital Commerce and Government eMarketplace rely heavily on artificial intelligence. Goyal further added that AI can play a huge role in our day-to-day lives.

162.title: SC to hear ED's plea against bail to Anil Deshmukh tomorrow
162.article_body: The Supreme Court will hear the Enforcement Directorate's plea against the Bombay High Court's decision granting bail to former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh in a money laundering case. The matter was mentioned before a bench of Chief Justice UU Lalit and Justice SR Bhat. On Tuesday, a bench led by Justice DY Chandrachud will hear the matter.

163.title: NRI doctor donates her entire ₹20-crore wealth to Andhra government hospital
163.article_body: A US-based Andhra Pradesh native doctor has donated her entire wealth of ₹20 crore to a government hospital in her hometown of Guntur, reports said. Immunologist and allergy specialist Dt Uma Devi Gavini, who studied at Guntur Medical College in 1965, made the donation to Guntur Government General Hospital (GGH) recently.

164.title: 'Unacceptable escalation': UN chief on Russian strikes across Ukraine
164.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres has condemned Russian missile strikes that hit multiple Ukrainian cities on Monday, calling it an "unacceptable escalation of the war", according to his spokesperson. "The Secretary-General is deeply shocked by today's large-scale missile attacks," the spokesperson added. Ukraine claims that Russia fired at least 75 missiles as part of the widespread strikes.

165.title: 400 kg of donkey meat seized in Andhra Pradesh; accused arrested
165.article_body: Over 400 kg of donkey meat was seized by police in Andhra Pradesh's Bapatla district on Monday. All persons involved in the illegal trade of donkey meat and slaughter have been arrested. "Donkeys are sensitive animals who form deep bonds with their families and friends and communicate with each other through a variety of sounds," a PETA India official said.

166.title: Wife of Telangana CID DGP killed in car accident in Rajasthan
166.article_body: A woman was killed and two others were injured when the car they were travelling in overturned in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer district. The deceased, Sheela Singh Jatav (56), was the wife of Telangana's DGP (CID) Govind Singh. The accident happened after the passengers were returning from the Tanot Mata temple. The injured have been admitted to Jawahar Hospital, police said.

167.title: India Cements enter pact with JSW Cement to divest stake in Springway mining
167.article_body: India Cements announced that it has entered a pact with JSW Cement to divest its entire stake in Springway Mining Pvt Ltd (SMPL). Informing the stock exchanges, India Cements said that the total consideration for the deal was ₹476.87 crore. India Cements added that JSW Cement paid ₹373.87 crore as part of the deal to acquire the stake in SMPL.

168.title: Man high on magic mushrooms grabs flight attendant's breast, creates chaos on US flight
168.article_body: A man from US' Miami named Cherruy Sevilla created chaos on a Miami-Washington, DC United Airlines flight & attacked a flight attendant while being high on magic mushrooms, authorities stated. He allegedly "yelled, exhibited disturbing/uncontrolled behaviour". He also "grabbed and twisted" breast of a flight attendant, as per affidavit filed in US District Court for Eastern District of Virginia.

169.title: Katrina wanted to play ghost in 'Phone...', she was after me: Producer Farhan
169.article_body: Farhan Akhtar, producer of 'Phone Bhoot', spoke about the upcoming horror-comedy film at its trailer launch event and said Katrina Kaif's interest in the role of a ghost left him shocked. "Katrina was after me...She wanted to play a ghost. Even we were confused about how someone beautiful like Katrina can play a ghost," he added.

170.title: IIT Bombay adds non-engineering subjects for UG in curriculum overhaul
170.article_body: Subjects from management, entrepreneurship and design courses have been added to regular engineering curriculum for undergraduate students at IIT Bombay. Professor Kishore Chatterjee said the idea is to help students "become leaders in whichever path they choose." Students will have to select at least two to three courses from each basket alongside its core subjects and courses.

171.title: Paid true tribute to Sardar Patel by resolving Kashmir issue: PM
171.article_body: In an apparent dig at Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru, PM Narendra Modi said "one person couldn't resolve the Kashmir issue" while Sardar Patel merged all other princely states. He added that he was able to find a solution as he is "following the footsteps" of Patel. The PM said he has paid 'true tributes to Sardar Patel by resolving the issue'.

172.title: 21-yr-old nursing student hangs herself in hostel room in UP
172.article_body: A 21-year-old nursing student died by suicide by hanging herself in her hostel room in Meerut, UP. The deceased has been identified as Arzoo, a BSc nursing student and a Delhi resident. Arzoo had been under stress and a suicide note was found, police said. Her mobile phone has been taken into custody by the police.

173.title: BJP govt helped improve India spot in ease of doing business list: PM
173.article_body: Speaking during a public rally in poll-bound Gujarat, Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday said that India's ranking in ease of doing business list has improved considerably after he took office in 2014, PTI reported. He added that BJP government has scrapped around 2,000 obsolete laws from the British-era that required industrialists to be sent to jail over minor issues.

174.title: Centre launches 24x7 tele-mental health service 'Tele-MANAS' in 20 states, UTs
174.article_body: The Union Health Ministry on Monday launched a 24x7 tele-mental health service called Tele Mental Health Assistance and Networking Across States (Tele-MANAS) on the occasion of World Mental Health Day.
