The service will begin in 20 states and UTs and will subsequently be expanded across the country. The service can be accessed by calling helpline numbers 14416 and 1-800-891-4416.

175.title: How does the Cricket World Cup Super League table read after India's victory?
175.article_body: India are now fifth on the Cricket World Cup Super League points table after defeating South Africa in the second ODI. India have accumulated a total of 119 points. South Africa are placed 11th with 59 points. Top-seven ranked teams and World Cup hosts (India) will automatically qualify for 2023 World Cup.

176.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states for next few days, list released
176.article_body: IMD stated heavy to very heavy rainfall is very likely over Arunachal Pradesh on October 11. Heavy rainfall is likely over Uttar Pradesh, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Telangana on October 11. Karnataka, West Bengal, Bihar, Sikkim, Assam and Meghalaya may witness heavy rainfall on October 11 and 12. Tamil Nadu and Puducherry may get it from October 11 to 14.

177.title: US recession likely in 6 to 9 months from now: JPMorgan CEO
177.article_body: America's largest bank JPMorgan Chase's CEO Jamie Dimon on Monday said that the US could tip into a recession in six to nine months from now. He cited runaway inflation, big interest rate hikes and the Russian invasion of Ukraine as the indicators of a potential recession. He also cited the unknown effects of the US Fed's quantitative easing policy.

178.title: Big B is 80 going on 20, he kept asking questions on sets: Parineeti
178.article_body: Speaking about veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan, actress Parineeti Chopra said, "Bachchan sir is like, I mean it with all my love and respect, he is 80 going on 20." She added that Amitabh has a student's mind. Amitabh and Parineeti will feature in Sooraj Barjatya's 'Uunchai'. "When I see him on set, he is constantly asking questions," she added.

179.title: IDBI Bank's privatisation process likely to conclude by September 2023: Report
179.article_body: According to a report, the privatisation process of IDBI bank is expected to conclude by September 2023. The financial bids for the sale will be invited by March next year. Last week, the government along with the Life Insurance Corporation invited preliminary bids for selling 60.72% stake in IDBI Bank. The deadline to submit Expression of Interest is December 16.

180.title: Record 5.4 lakh vehicles sold during Navratri in 2022: FADA
180.article_body: Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) on Monday said the vehicle retail sales in the country rose 57% during the Navratri festival this year. According to FADA, India reported a record sales of nearly 5.4 lakh vehicles between September 26 and October 5, 2022. Two-wheeler retail sales in this year's Navratri festival reported a growth of 52.35% to 3,69,020 units.

181.title: 'Doctor G' makers organise special screening for doctors in Mumbai
181.article_body: The makers of Ayushmann Khurrana and Rakul Preet Singh-starrer 'Doctor G' recently organised a special screening for doctors in Mumbai. According to reports, over 50 doctors along with their family members attended the screening. Directed by Anubhuti Kashyap, 'Doctor G' will be released on October 14. The comedy-drama film also stars Shefali Shah and Sheeba Chadha.

182.title: Coal Ministry issues allocation order for 12 coal mines
182.article_body: Ministry of Coal has issued allocation orders for 12 coal mines for which the Coal Mine Development and Production Agreement was signed on August 17. The mines are expected to generate annual revenue of ₹3,569 crore and attract capital investment of ₹3,208 crore. The cumulative Peak Rated Capacity of the mines is 21 million tonnes per annum.

183.title: How can an animated film be called big movie?: Tammareddy on 'Adipurush'
183.article_body: Speaking about 'Adipurush', Telugu filmmaker Tammareddy Bharadwaj has said that he does not understand how an animated film can be called a big movie. "A huge hype was created on the film as it was said...the film is being made with ₹500 crore. But the teaser was very disappointing," he added. 'Adipurush' was trolled over its VFX on Twitter.

184.title: Adani Ports gets NCLT nod to acquire remaining 58.1% stake in Gangavaram Port
184.article_body: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) received approval from the NCLT to acquire the remaining 58.1% stake in Gangavaram Port Limited (GPL) via the composite scheme of arrangement. The acquisition involves 517 million shares at ₹120 per share amounting to ₹6,200 crore and will be done through a share swap arrangement. GPL is located next to Vizag Port.

185.title: Need thorough law for job security of those going abroad: Kerala CM
185.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has called for comprehensive immigration law to ensure job security and the welfare of persons going abroad for employment. He added that it was not the policy of the state government to send everyone abroad and it instead aims to create a "new Kerala". Vijayan said he wanted to make Kerala a higher education hub.

186.title: Beauty parlour operator raped at gunpoint in UP; man booked
186.article_body: A beauty parlour operator in Muradnagar town in UP's Ghaziabad district was allegedly raped at gunpoint by a man. The accused came in contact with the victim through a pamphlet which she had distributed for the parlour's publicity, police said. The accused also allegedly shot a video and threatened to make it viral if the victim went against him.

187.title: Indian Navy's 1st Training Squadron arrives at Dubai's Port Rashid
187.article_body: Three ships of the Indian Navy's 1st Training Squadron (1TS) entered Dubai's Port Rashid on Monday as part of a long-range training deployment. INS Tir, INS Sujata and Coast Guard Ship Sarathi were received by India's Defence Attache and UAE Navy officials. "The deployment...is aimed at exposing...trainees to...conduct of various evolutions at sea and port familiarization," Defence Ministry said.

188.title: Tracxn Technologies' ₹309.38 crore IPO subscribed 13% on Day 1
188.article_body: Tracxn﻿ Technologies, a Bengaluru-based market data startup, launched its initial public offering on Monday. The IPO was subscribed 13% on the first day of bidding, Times Now reported. The portion set aside for retail investors was subscribed 0.71 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was subscribed 0.01 times. Tracxn﻿ Technologies has set its price band at ₹75-₹80 apiece for IPO.

189.title: Ajay Devgn announces film with Neeraj Pandey, to release in 2023
189.article_body: Ajay Devgn took to Twitter to announce his upcoming project with filmmaker Neeraj Pandey. He added that the film will release in theatres on June 16, 2023. Neeraj is known for directing films like 'Baby', 'Special 26' and 'A Wednesday'. Ajay will next be seen in 'Thank God', which is set to release on October 25.

190.title: West didn't give us weapons for decades: Jaishankar on India buying Russian weapons
190.article_body: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar defended India's "substantial inventory" of Russian-origin weapons saying there are "a variety of reasons" behind it. "For decades, western countries didn't supply weapons to India," said Jaishankar. Western nations saw "a military dictatorship next to us as the preferred partner", he said in an apparent reference to Pakistan.

191.title: Lot of bad feelings in me back then: Aubameyang on video criticising Arteta
191.article_body: Chelsea forward Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang clarified that the video of him criticising Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta was in the past. "At the time I still had a lot of bad feelings in me...I wish all my old guys well," said Aubameyang. The video showed former Arsenal striker Aubameyang saying that Arteta "can't deal" with "big characters and big players".

192.title: 'Flaming torch' election symbol will make Shiv Sena stronger: Raut
192.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena's new election symbol, 'flaming torch', will make the party stronger in future. "Earlier, symbols of Jansangh and Congress were also frozen...Those parties also got bigger after the new symbols. We will grow," Raut said. Election Commission has also allotted the name 'Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray)' to the Thackeray-led faction.

193.title: Heard people call us 'B' side, I was really upset: Ishan Kishan on India squad for SA ODIs
193.article_body: Talking about Team India squad for the ongoing ODI series against South Africa being termed as "second-string side" by many, wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan said, "I heard people call us the 'B' side. I was really upset." He added, "We wanted to play our A game (in second ODI)...Everybody is in their prime form and hopefully we'll win the third ODI."

194.title: Goa bars, restaurants to provide cabs to customers in drunken state
194.article_body: The Goa government is planning to make it compulsory for bar and restaurant owners to arrange cabs for their customers in drunken state to drop them home or in hotels, in case of tourists. "This is a new norm in Goa for the safety of people. We will implement it very strictly," state Transport Minister Mauvin Godinho said.

195.title: Done with rookie drivers for the foreseeable future: Haas F1 boss
195.article_body: Haas F1 boss Guenther Steiner said he was "done" with rookies "for the foreseeable future" with regards to his team's 2023 drivers' line-up. "Need to see what is best for the team or...who is the best driver," said Steiner. He added they did not want to be thinking "we did this too quick" when it comes to 2023 drivers.

196.title: Amazon-backed Rivian recalls nearly all its EVs; its shares fall 9%
196.article_body: Amazon-backed EV-maker Rivian on Friday recalled nearly all its 13,000 vehicles due to a possible loose fastener that could cause the driver to lose steering control. Following the recall, which sparked concerns that the EV-maker may not meet its 2023 production target, Rivian's shares fell about 9% on Monday. Rivian had cut its 2022 production target by half in March.

197.title: Ex-Delhi minister to be questioned by police over conversion event
197.article_body: The Delhi Police has issued a notice to AAP leader Rajendra Pal Gautam to appear for questioning in connection with a religious conversion event on Tuesday. He quit the Delhi Cabinet on Sunday amid controversy over his participation in the event. Delhi Police officials said the notice has been issued to know all details.

198.title: Finance Minister Sitharaman to attend IMF, World Bank annual meetings in US
198.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will attend the annual meetings of IMF and World Bank during her six-day visit to US, starting October 11. She will also attend the meetings of the G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors. The minister would also meet US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen and World Bank President David Malpass separately.

199.title: S Jaishankar gifts bat signed by Virat Kohli to Deputy PM of Australia, he shares pic
199.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar gifted a bat signed by Virat Kohli to Deputy PM of Australia Richard Marles. Sharing a picture on Twitter, Marles wrote, "A pleasure to host @DrSJaishankar here in Canberra. There are many things which bind us, including our love of cricket. Today, he surprised me with a signed bat from cricket legend...@imVkohli."

200.title: Aviation Minister Scindia announced projects worth ₹2,361 crore for J&K
200.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia on Monday announced projects worth ₹2,361 crore for Jammu and Kashmir (J&K). Scindia said that a Civil Enclave (Airport) worth ₹861 crore will come up at Jammu. Further, the minister said that Srinagar's present terminal will be expanded three times from 20,000 square metres to 60,000 square metres at a cost of ₹1,500 crore.

201.title: 2 local LeT terrorists killed in encounter in J&K's Anantnag
201.article_body: Two local terrorists belonging to Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) were killed in an encounter with security forces in J&K's Anantnag district on Monday, police informed. Two soldiers and an Army dog were injured in the operation, the Indian Army said. The encounter broke out after terrorists opened fire at security forces personnel during a search operation in the Tangpawa area, police added.

202.title: 12 die in rain-related incidents across UP; CM orders relief work
202.article_body: At least 12 people died in rain-related incidents across Uttar Pradesh between 10 pm on Sunday to 5 pm on Monday. Five of the total deaths were caused by the collapse of house walls, while three persons died by snake bite, two by lightning and one by drowning. CM Yogi Adityanath has directed officials to carry out relief operations.

203.title: I'm exhausted with questions about my body transformation: Shehnaaz
203.article_body: During her appearance on the show 'Bingo! Comedy Adda Season 2', host Varun Sharma asked Shehnaaz Gill about her body transformation. To this, she replied, "I've become exhausted answering this question about my physique." Shehnaaz added she can feel the extra weight after eating something "delicious" despite controlling her diet for a week. "My body doesn't...listen to me," she stated.

204.title: It's a picnic: Sumeet Vyas on working with 'Tripling' co-stars Maanvi, Amol
204.article_body: Sumeet Vyas, speaking about working on web show 'Tripling', said, "The two months of shooting and rehearsal are something that I...look forward to because it's a...small unit of six actors." "We've...known each other for many years...so it's...a picnic for us to meet each other," he added. The show also stars Maanvi Gagroo and Amol Parashar, among others, in pivotal roles.

205.title: Sourav Ganguly-backed Flickstree raises $5 mn in pre-Series B round
205.article_body: AI startup Flickstree has raised $5 million in its pre-Series B funding round led by Venture Catalysts Group. Founded in 2016 by Saurabh Singh, Rahul Jain and Nagendra Sandra, Flickstree is a content-led video commerce platform enabling transactions for brand partners, leveraging in-house video content created with patented AI. The platform was backed by Sourav Ganguly in 2017.

206.title: PhonePe founders acquire Mumbai team in Prime Volleyball League
206.article_body: Payments startup PhonePe Co-founders Sameer Nigam and Rahul Chari have acquired the Mumbai Meteors franchise in the Prime Volleyball League (PVL). Former Indian volleyball team captain Abhijit Bhattacharya has been appointed as the General Manager of the Mumbai Meteors. Sameer Nigam said that he is a regular volleyball player and is excited about this opportunity.

207.title: Flipkart & Samsung announce 'crazy' price drop on Samsung Galaxy Z Flip3
207.article_body: Flipkart has revealed that Samsung's flagship foldable smartphone, Galaxy Z Flip3, is available for ₹59,999 only during its Big Diwali Sale. This was announced during Flipkart's live event 'FlipAtFlipkart' on 'The Zero Hour'. Exchange offers make the price even more lucrative, Flipkart shared. No-cost EMI is available for 12 months. The Big Diwali Sale goes live tonight, October 11.

208.title: Haryana man promises '3 airports, free makeup kits' in Sarpanch manifesto
208.article_body: Bhai Jaikaran Lathwal from Haryana's Sarsadh village promised "three airports, no GST and free makeup kits" in his Sarpanch election manifesto. A picture of his manifesto, which promises petrol at ₹20/litre, a metro line from the village to Delhi, free Wi-Fi service and alcohol bottles for addicts, has gone viral. "I'm shifting to this village," a Twitter user wrote.

209.title: Bank of Maharashtra raises lending rate by 20 bps; EMIs to go up
209.article_body: The Bank of Maharashtra (BoM) on Monday raised its marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by 20 basis points to 7.80% across different tenors. The benchmark one-year MCLR, which was 7.60% till now, will now be 7.80% from Monday, October 10, 2022. As a result of the hike revision, housing, vehicle and personal loans will become more costlier.

210.title: Don't know if someone in B'wood wants to work with me: Pak actor Fawad Khan
210.article_body: Pakistani actor Fawad Khan has said he does not know if someone in Bollywood wants to work with him. "I'll do my work and go away but then the people who'll have to suffer are those who want to collaborate with me," he added. Karan Johar's 'Ae Dil Hai Mushkil' was Fawad's last appearance in a Bollywood film.

211.title: Is PM Modi campaigning for Congress in Gujarat: Kejriwal
211.article_body: After PM Narendra Modi cautioned BJP workers against taking Congress lightly in the upcoming state Assembly elections, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked if PM Modi is campaigning for Congress in Gujarat. "Congress is trying to infiltrate with a new strategy. It does not speak but is reaching out to villages [by] holding meetings," PM Modi told the BJP workers.

212.title: L'Oréal to pay ₹186.4 cr profit it collected after 10% GST rate cut in 2017
212.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday directed L'Oréal India to pay ₹186.39 crore profit it collected after the government introduced a reduction in GST rates from 28% to 18% in November 2017. L'Oréal will submit the profiteered amount to Consumer Welfare Fund in six equal instalments. A probe had found L'Oréal didn't pass profiteered amount on products like shampoos and conditioners.

213.title: Avoid non-essential travel: Advisory for Indians in Ukraine amid Russian strikes
213.article_body: Amid an escalation in the Ukraine-Russia conflict on Monday, the Indian embassy in Kyiv advised all Indian nationals there to "avoid all non-essential travel to and within Ukraine". "They (Indians) must strictly follow the safety and security guidelines...They're requested to keep the Embassy informed about the status of their presence in Ukraine," said the embassy.

214.title: HC closes all cases against Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain under Benami Act
214.article_body: Delhi HC on Monday closed all proceedings against Delhi Minister and AAP leader Satyendar Jain under the Benami Transactions (Prohibition) Amendment Act. Jain's counsel had claimed the Benami proceedings against him had nature of political persecution. Reacting to HC's order, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said, "How good it'd be if they use time for nation-building rather than filing fake cases."

215.title: He said, 'You'll be PM again': PM Modi recalls Mulayam Singh's 2019 Lok Sabha speech
215.article_body: PM Narendra Modi, while addressing a rally in Gujarat's Bharuch, recalled Mulayam Singh Yadav's 2019 speech wherein the late leader had praised him. "He (Mulayam Singh) said 'Modi ji takes everyone along and that's why I know he will be elected as the PM again'," recalled PM Modi. "What a big heart one must have (to say this)," he added.

216.title: Forcing employees to keep webcam on is violation of human rights: Dutch court
216.article_body: A Dutch court ruled that forcing employees to keep webcam on is violation of human rights. The court was hearing a case where a remote Dutch employee was fired by a US company for not keeping his webcam on. The court stated demanding webcam surveillance is in conflict with the respect of workers' privacy and it's a human rights violation.

217.title: Heat from fingertips can be used to crack passwords in seconds: Researchers
217.article_body: A research by the University of Glasgow researchers shows computer and smartphone users' passwords can be guessed in seconds by analysing the heat their fingertips leave on keyboards and screens. They trained an AI model to effectively read the images and make guesses about the passwords. Their system revealed 86% of passwords when thermal images are taken within 20 seconds.

218.title: Tamil Nadu govt allows bursting of less-polluting crackers on Diwali
218.article_body: The Tamil Nadu government on Monday allowed the bursting of firecrackers with certain restrictions on Diwali. Only less-polluting and low sound-generating crackers will be allowed during two fixed-time windows, from 6 am to 7 am and from 7 pm to 8 pm. People have been asked to seek permission from district administration or local bodies concerned for community fire cracking.

219.title: Don't lose focus, we need cooperation to save country: Tejashwi
219.article_body: RJD Chairperson Tejashwi Yadav asked his party members to iron out the differences between them. "We may not like each other...Despite our differences, I would like to request...please do not lose focus of the larger picture," Tejashwi said. He added, "We need everyone's cooperation to save the country...Such small fights will put us on the defensive."

220.title: Taiwan's 'insistence on independence' root cause of tensions: China
220.article_body: The root cause of tensions in the Taiwan Strait is the Taiwanese government's "insistence on...independence", the Chinese foreign ministry said on Monday, adding that Taiwan is an inseparable part of China's territory. The remark came as a response to Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen's speech where she said that a war between Taiwan and China is "absolutely not an option".

221.title: Keep inspiring us with cinematic brilliance: Mahesh on Rajamouli's b'day
221.article_body: Actor Mahesh Babu took to Twitter and wished 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli on his 49th birthday. He tweeted, "Keep inspiring us with your cinematic brilliance! Happiness and success always!" Mahesh will be working with Rajamouli on an untitled project soon. 'RRR' actor Jr NTR tweeted, "Happy Birthday Jakkanna @ssrajamouli!! Wishing you the best as always."

222.title: Shiv Sena Uddhav faction gets new name, 'flaming torch' election symbol
222.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) has allotted the name 'Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray)' and the 'flaming torch' symbol to former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's faction for the Andheri East bypoll. The Eknath Shinde-led faction, which will fight the election under the name 'Balasahebanchi Shiv Sena', has been asked to submit a new list of symbols by 10 am on Tuesday.

223.title: 2 trekkers stranded at Kalihani Pass of Himachal Pradesh rescued
223.article_body: Two trekkers stranded at Himachal Pradesh's Kalihani Pass were rescued by a seven-member team, Kullu district administration said on Monday. "One of the trekkers...suffered from snow blindness and had to be carried all the way down," a senior official said. "The trekkers had run out of food after they took refuge under a rock for three days," he added.

224.title: US firm fires Dutch employee over webcam, court awards him money more than his 1-yr salary
224.article_body: A remote Dutch employee of a US company, who was fired for refusing to leave his webcam on while he was working, has been awarded around €75,000 by a Dutch court for "wrongful termination". The employee had alleged his termination was disproportionate, and the demand to leave his webcam turned on contravened data privacy rules. He was earning over €70,000/year.

225.title: 5 tribals beaten up for taking picture of Durga idol in Jharkhand
225.article_body: Five tribals were beaten up allegedly by a village head and others for taking a photograph of a Durga idol in Jharkhand's Garhwa, police said. The man who took the picture was also tonsured. "When I was taking picture of a Durga idol on the immersion day, I was driven out of Puja mandap by some men," the man said.

226.title: I should retire after having worked with Alia, Deepika, Katrina: Siddhant
226.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said he should retire from acting after having worked with actresses Alia Bhatt, Deepika Padukone and Katrina Kaif. Siddhant, who starred in 'Gully Boy' with Alia and 'Gehraiyaan' with Deepika, will next feature with Katrina in 'Phone Bhoot'. "They are...the most celebrated [actresses] in modern times....it's an honour for me to work with all...of them," he added.

227.title: Anand Pandit pledges 8,000 meals in orphanages on Big B's 80th b'day
227.article_body: To mark Amitabh Bachchan's 80th birthday, producer Anand Pandit has pledged to distribute 8,000 meals in orphanages across Mumbai and Gujarat. He'll also be donating 800 hearing aids to senior citizens and kids in Mumbai. "Completing eight 'parikramas' around...earth with such joy...is no small milestone and I wanted to make a special gesture to celebrate this momentous day," Anand said.

228.title: UK sanctions Iran's morality police 'in its entirety'
228.article_body: The UK on Monday announced it has sanctioned Iran's "Morality Police in its entirety". Justifying its action, the British government said that the force has "used the threat of detention and violence to control what Iranian women wear and how they behave" for decades. A communique on the matter also mentioned Mahsa Amini, who died while in morality police's custody.

229.title: Fell in love with India while reading 'Shantaram': Pacific Rim's Charlie
229.article_body: English actor Charlie Hunnam, who featured in films like 'Pacific Rim' and 'The Gentlemen', has revealed that he fell in love with India while reading Gregory David Roberts' 'Shantaram'. Charlie will feature in the show 'Shantaram', which is based on the 2003 novel. "The show to me feels really timeless...there are little nods to fashion, set direction," Charlie added.

230.title: A dream come true: 'Goodbye' actor Abhishekh on receiving letter from Big B
230.article_body: Actor Abhishekh Khan, who stars in Amitabh Bachchan's 'Goodbye', said getting a handwritten letter from the veteran actor was "like a dream come true". Abhishekh received the letter after he wrote a letter to Amitabh, thanking him for being welcoming. "One of the greatest actors to acknowledge me in such a manner was an honour in itself," Abhishekh added.

231.title: Google to launch its first foldable smartphone by early 2023: Reports
231.article_body: Google's first foldable smartphone is likely to be launched in the first quarter of 2023, according to reports. The foldable phone will reportedly feature a 5.8 inch cover screen and Google's custom-made Tensor chipset. It will reportedly also have a 64 megapixel primary camera, a 12 megapixel ultra-wide camera and 10.8 megapixel front-facing camera.

232.title: Deverakonda gets emotional while addressing Liger failure, says 'We all have sh**ty days'
232.article_body: During an award function, actor Vijay Deverakonda got emotional while addressing the failure of 'Liger'. He said, "We all have good days. We all have not-so-good days. We all have sh**ty days. But irrespective of how we feel, we get up." He added, "I promise to you...I'll get the job done for all of you and you will be entertained."

233.title: Ashwin responds to Ramiz Raja's 'Team India have started respecting Pakistan' remark
233.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin responded to Pakistan Cricket Board chief Ramiz Raja's remark that Team India have started respecting Pakistan after losing a couple of matches against them in last two years. Ashwin stated, "Respect for...opposition isn't something that comes with victories and defeat. It comes with how you are made, and we certainly respect the Pakistani side, and so do they."

234.title: RWA of Noida's Sector 51 demands increase in police patrolling
234.article_body: The Resident's Welfare Association of Sector 51, Noida has demanded an increase in police patrolling after gunshots were allegedly fired outside the sector's main gate when two groups were fighting on Friday. "We are concerned and afraid that there are miscreants living around the sector and are firing openly without fear of the law," a resident said.

235.title: TCS hits out at moonlighting after Wipro, Infosys, calls it an 'ethical issue'
235.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Monday said moonlighting was an ethical issue and was against the company's core values. TCS' Chief HR Officer Milind Lakkad said the company's position on moonlighting was communicated to employees, however, no action has been taken so far against someone. Earlier, Infosys warned its employees against moonlighting while Wipro fired 300 for moonlighting.

236.title: Nandan Nilekani's family trust buys property for ₹59 crore in Bengaluru
236.article_body: NRJN Family Trust, established by Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani, has bought a property in Bengaluru's Koramangala area for ₹59 crore, documents accessed by Zapkey.com showed. The property has a total built-up area of 4,200 sq ft and the plot area is around 9,600 sq ft. According to real estate brokers, this is perhaps the most expensive deal in the area.

237.title: They talk rubbish, then say Hindus are trolling: Agnihotri on bank ad featuring Aamir
237.article_body: Vivek Agnihotri reacted to a bank ad featuring Aamir Khan and Kiara Advani as groom and bride. In the ad, Aamir says, "Why should traditions that have continued for centuries continue to do so?" Vivek tweeted, "I...fail to understand since when banks have become responsible for changing social...religious traditions?" "They talk rubbish and then say Hindus are trolling," he added.

238.title: Delhi Police issues traffic advisory for India-South Africa ODI tomorrow
238.article_body: Delhi Police has put in place special traffic arrangements in the wake of India-South Africa ODI match at the Arun Jaitley Stadium in Delhi on Tuesday. Commuters and visitors have been advised to follow the advisory for convenience. There will be traffic diversion for half an hour before the match as well as after the conclusion of the match.

239.title: Agra residents rename colony to ‘Keechad Nagar’ due to waterlogging
239.article_body: Residents of Agra have renamed their colonies to 'Keechad Nagar', 'Nala Sarovar', 'Badbu Vihar', 'Narak Puri' and 'Ghinona Nagar' in order to protest against damaged and waterlogged roads. "We've not received any help from the district administration," a local said. "We've complained everywhere, including MPs, MLAs and concerned departments, but all in vain," he added.

240.title: India bowl out Thailand for just 37 runs in Women's Asia Cup, 10 batters score 7 or less
240.article_body: India dismissed Thailand for just 37 runs in their Women's Asia Cup T20 2022 match. As many as ten Thailand batters scored seven runs or less. Nannapat Koncharoenkai top-scored for Thailand with 12(19). India's Sneh Rana registered bowling figures of 4-0-9-3, while Deepti Sharma and Rajeshwari Gayakwad took two wickets each. India chased down the target in six overs.

241.title: Ananya shares old pic with Rekha on her b'day, calls her 'ultimate queen'
241.article_body: Actress Ananya Panday took to Instagram Stories on Monday to share a post wishing Rekha on her birthday. "Then and now - forever a fan girl," she wrote while sharing photos of herself with the veteran actress. Ananya also called her "the ultimate queen". Rekha, who has appeared in over 180 projects so far, turned 68 on October 10.

242.title: Elephant, her calf die after being hit by Rajdhani Express in Assam
242.article_body: A mother elephant and her calf died after allegedly being hit by a Rajdhani Express train near Kharikatia railway station in Assam's Jorhat on Sunday night, forest officials confirmed on Monday. The forest department had alerted Railways about the movement of elephants in the area and requested them to control the train's speed, but they didn't oblige, an official said.

243.title: Gujarat & BJP have unbreakable ties: PM Modi in Anand
243.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking in Gujarat's Anand district on Monday said, "Gujarat and the BJP have unbreakable ties. Wherever there is talk of Gujarat, the BJP appears." He added, "Gujarat has always kept the lotus blossom. Everyone in the state understands that the Gujarat BJP stands for service." PM Modi was addressing a public rally at Vallabh Vidyanagar.

244.title: Order to be based on pollution levels: SC on Delhi firecracker ban
244.article_body: The Supreme Court refused to intervene in the case pertaining to the ban on firecrackers in Delhi, stating that an order would be passed based on air pollution levels. The petition said freedom of religion cannot be taken away on the pretext of the right to life. SC said the plea would be heard before the Diwali vacation.

245.title: HC directs DMRC to make ₹4,500 cr payment to Reliance Infra by Oct 31
245.article_body: Delhi HC has granted Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) time till October 31 to pay a ₹4,500-crore arbitration award to Reliance Infrastructure's subsidiary Delhi Airport Metro Express (DAME). The award relates to DMRC terminating a contract according to which, DAME was supposed to run Delhi Metro's Airport Express Line. DAME had invoked arbitration proceedings after DMRC terminated the contract.

246.title: Don't get complacent, Cong working silently this time: PM Modi to BJP workers
246.article_body: PM Narendra Modi warned BJP workers against becoming complacent about the Congress in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls. During a Jan Vishwas Sammelan at Anand, PM Modi said, "The Congress is too silent, but don't assume it is finished...They are quietly going around villages to strengthen the ground," PM Modi said. He added, "[They are] doing 'khatla baithaks' [in villages]."

247.title: Mumbai man unplugs ATM during withdrawal to cheat bank of ₹2.77 lakh
247.article_body: An unidentified man has been booked for cheating a bank of ₹2.77 lakh by unplugging an ATM in Mumbai's Khar as soon as it dispensed cash. The unplugged ATM would register the transaction as cancelled and revert the amount back to the account. The police said the man was using a cloned debit card and a group may be involved.

248.title: Hyd man falls from 3rd floor while bending down to spit paan, dies
248.article_body: A 42-year-old Hyderabad man lost his balance and fell from the 3rd floor of his house while bending down to spit paan, reports said. He sustained a head injury and was shifted to Gandhi Hospital, where he died while undergoing treatment. The deceased was a daily wager and lived with his family, reports added.

249.title: 'Deeply concerned,' says India as Ukraine war escalates; issues statement
249.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Monday said, "India is deeply concerned at the escalation of conflict in Ukraine...targeting of infrastructure and deaths of civilians." It urged "immediate cessation of hostilities and...return to the path of diplomacy and dialogue". "India stands ready to support all...(de-escalation) efforts," said MEA, as Russia struck Ukrainian cities with missiles.

250.title: Guj AAP chief calls PM 'neech', says BJP attacks him because he's a Patidar
250.article_body: Responding to BJP's attack on him over a purported video in which he allegedly called PM Narendra Modi "neech", Gujarat AAP chief Gopal Italia has said he was being attacked because he was a Patidar. "The abusive and indecent language used by Sh. Gopal Italia is gender biased, misogynist and condemnable," NCW tweeted.

251.title: TCS reports net profit of ₹10,465 crore in Q2 FY23
251.article_body: TCS announced its results for the quarter ended September 2022, reporting a consolidated net profit of ₹10,465 crore at a year-on-year growth of 8.41%. TCS said the revenue from operations grew by 18.01% year-on-year to ₹55,309 crore, while revenue grew 4.83% compared to the previous quarter. In constant currency terms, the company saw a 15.4% year-on-year growth in revenue.

252.title: You're not qualified to understand: Sona to man criticising her version of 'Pasoori'
252.article_body: Singer Sona Mohapatra has responded to a man who took to Twitter to criticise her version of the song 'Pasoori'. The man said her voice "wasn't up to the mark". Sona responded, "Sorry to say...but you're not qualified to understand that it's more to do with a composition that can only sound good with a track & heavy music production."

253.title: Pune man uses hidden device during defence recruitment exam; held
253.article_body: Pune Police arrested a youth from Haryana after he was found in possession of a hidden mobile communication device wrapped in dressing tape during an examination for the recruitment of defence civilian employees on Sunday. The device was hidden inside the 22-year-old's shirt, an officer said, adding that the police is probing whether the arrested candidate has any accomplices.

254.title: Uddhav moves Delhi HC against EC order freezing Shiv Sena name, symbol
254.article_body: The Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena faction on Monday approached the Delhi High Court with an aim to quash the EC's order of freezing the party name and election symbol. Both parties were asked to shortlist three symbols and party name alternatives. Uddhav-led faction chose 'Trishul', 'Mashal' and 'Rising Sun' as symbols, while the Shinde-led faction chose 'Tutari', 'Gada' and 'Talwar'.

255.title: Was going to reject Rolex's role in Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram': Suriya
255.article_body: Actor Suriya, speaking about playing Rolex in Kamal Haasan-starrer 'Vikram', revealed it was a last-minute decision to play the role. "I was going to...tell director Lokesh Kanagaraj, I won't do it. But I did it for one man," Suriya said referring to Kamal. "No matter what I'm doing in life, Kamal sir would've always been my inspiration," he added.

256.title: Police book 15 people for usurping land in Pune's Dighi
256.article_body: The police in Pune's Dighi district booked 15 people for allegedly preparing fake land documents for a plot that is owned by 62-year-old Khandu Balwant Pawar. The accused took over 20 guntas out of 44.50 guntas using fake documents and threatened the owner with dire consequences. A case was registered at the Dighi police station.

257.title: Over 100 Thane society residents go on hunger strike against builder
257.article_body: More than 100 residents of the Keshav Heights building in Kalwa, Thane, have gone on a hunger strike against the builder for allegedly not providing them with basic facilities. "Builder didn't even provide...garbage collection or disposal," said residents, adding that the parking did not have a fire extinguisher. The builder said he will meet with residents to resolve the issues.

258.title: Didn't have much experience in administration when I became Guj CM: PM
258.article_body: Addressing a rally in Gujarat, PM Narendra Modi said, "When I became Gujarat CM, I didn't have much experience in administration." "But it's our privilege that CM Bhupendra Patel has an experience of around 25 years ranging from panchayat to Assembly," he added. Notably, PM Modi laid the foundation stone of various development projects in Gujarat worth over ₹8,000 crore.

259.title: Share trader abducted for ₹20 cr ransom rescued by Pune Police, 4 arrested
259.article_body: The Pune Police rescued a share market trader and his friend, who were allegedly abducted for a ransom of ₹20 crore. The accused were criminals linked to the Gaja Marne gang. According to the probe, the victims were kept on the move along the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway in Pune. Four gang members were arrested in connection with the case.

260.title: Mulayam Singh's mortal remains reach his ancestral village Saifai in UP
260.article_body: The mortal remains of Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav reached his ancestral village Saifai on Monday evening. His last rites will be held on Tuesday. A convoy of 300 vehicles carried his body to Saifai from Gurugram's Medanta Hospital, where he passed away on Monday after a prolonged illness.

261.title: Strikes hit building that houses visa office in Kyiv: Germany
261.article_body: A building that houses the visa office of the German embassy in Kyiv was hit during Russian strikes on the city during Monday's rush hours, the German foreign ministry informed. It added that the office has not been used since the onset of the war in Ukraine. "Our colleagues at the Embassy in Kyiv are well," the foreign ministry stated.

262.title: Adani Group in talks to raise $10 billion for expansion plans: Report
262.article_body: Gautam Adani and his family have reportedly held talks with investors, including Singapore investment firms Temasek and GIC, to raise at least $10 billion to fund its expansion into clean energy, ports and cement businesses. Gautam Adani had previously said that Adani Group will invest over $100 billion over the next decade, most of it in the energy transition business.

263.title: Voice of socialist ideas fallen silent with Mulayam Singh's demise: Sonia
263.article_body: Congress interim President Sonia Gandhi on Monday condoled the demise of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. She said the voice of socialist ideas has fallen silent with his demise. Yadav, the three-time former Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister, passed away at the age of 82 at Medanta Hospital in Haryana's Gurugram on Monday.

264.title: Blackmailed with private video, 22-yr-old dies by suicide in Pune
264.article_body: A 22-year-old student died by suicide after he was blackmailed by an online fraudster who threatened to upload his private video on social media, officers said. The accused pretended to be a woman and shot an obscene video, following which he demanded money for not uploading it on social media platforms, said Assistant Police Inspector Berad.

265.title: Pathetic, in one word this is cheating: Venkatesh on video of Wade pushing Mark Wood
265.article_body: Reacting to Australia wicketkeeper-batter Matthew Wade pushing England pacer Mark Wood while the latter was going for a catch, ex-India pacer Venkatesh Prasad tweeted, "Pathetic, in one word this is cheating, not in the spirit of the game." He added, "The sense of entitlement of these guys is unbelievable. Bulls****ing about spirit of the game when there is no spirit."

266.title: Initially, I was entertained: Radhika on rumours of her dating Tusshar Kapoor
266.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has revealed that those handling the promotions of her film 'Shor in the City' were responsible for the rumours about her dating co-star Tusshar Kapoor. "Initially, I was very entertained, because I got an article that I was apparently in Goa celebrating Valentine's Day with Tusshar and I was studying for my exams in London," she added.

267.title: Mulayam was deeply committed to socialist political traditions: Deve Gowda
267.article_body: Former PM HD Deve Gowda said that ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav was "deeply committed to the secular and socialist political traditions". Mulayam (82) died on Monday at a private hospital in Gurugram after a prolonged illness. Gowda's JD(S) and Mulayam's SP were formed after breaking out from the erstwhile Janata Dal (People's Party).

268.title: Large Indian traders avoid rupee trade with Russia due to sanction fears: Report
268.article_body: Large Indian lenders are reportedly reluctant to process direct rupee trade transactions with Russia due to fears of being targeted by sanctions by the US and Europe. Banks like State Bank of India and Punjab National Bank were among the lenders, according to sources. Two smaller lenders have moved to adopt a mechanism to settle trade with Russia in rupees.

269.title: 4 arrested for plotting to kill Uttarakhand Minister Saurabh Bahuguna
269.article_body: Four people have been arrested for allegedly planning to kill Uttarakhand Cabinet Minister Saurabh Bahuguna. Police said the conspiracy was hatched by a man jailed in Haldwani prison. He held the minister responsible for his imprisonment and was in contact with some shooters from Uttar Pradesh to execute the plan.

270.title: TCS adds 35,000 freshers in the first half of FY23, says 'all job offers honoured'
270.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) onboarded 35,000 freshers during the first half of FY23 and 20,000 of these were onboarded in Q2 itself, the company said on Monday. In comparison, the company hired 43,000 freshers in the first half of FY22. TCS' Chief HR Officer Milind Lakkad said that TCS has honoured all job offers the company had made.

271.title: 23-yr-old tries to steal Ex-Maha CM's phone from Mumbai-bound train; arrested
271.article_body: A 23-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly trying to steal the phone of former Maharashtra CM Sushil Kumar Shinde, who was travelling by train from his hometown of Solapur to Mumbai. Shinde's daughter caught the accused red-handed when the former Minister had gone to the toilet, reports said. The accused was caught and handed over to the GRP.

272.title: Freedom being misused: India on Khalistani activity in Canada
272.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday said that India has flagged issues related to Khalistani forces operating out of Canada. Jaishankar said, "We have flagged the need to ensure that freedoms in a democratic society are not misused by forces which actually advocate violence and bigotry." The minister reminded Canada of the "responsibility that democracies have to other democracies".

273.title: Ready to step up aid to Kyiv, France says after latest Russian strikes
273.article_body: In a call with his Ukrainian counterpart Volodymyr Zelenskyy, French President Emmanuel Macron expressed France's commitment to step up military aid for Ukraine's war efforts against Russia, the Elysee said. The call took place after Russia reportedly struck multiple Ukrainian cities during rush hour on Monday. This came following an explosion on a bridge that connects mainland Russia to Crimea.

274.title: Snapchat launches 'Family Centre' feature for parental controls in India
274.article_body: Snapchat has rolled out parental controls in India in the form of in-app tool called 'Family Centre'. These controls will allow parents of children between 13-18 years of age to see who they are friends with and who they have messaged without revealing the content of the messages. Parents can confidentially report suspicious accounts on 'Family Centre', the company said.

275.title: Student boarding BMTC bus injured after being crushed under its rear wheel
275.article_body: A 23-year-old post-graduate student sustained grievous injuries after she slipped while boarding a Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) bus and was crushed under one of its rear wheels near the Jnana Bharathi campus of Bangalore University. Students at the university held a protest over the driver's alleged carelessness. The driver has been arrested and the bus has been impounded.

276.title: PMC blacklists 13 contractors over poor quality of roads in Pune
276.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has blacklisted 13 contractors for carrying out poor quality work and fined seven deputy engineers of the road department over poor condition of roads in Pune. The contractors and engineers have been fined ₹5,000 and ₹15,000, respectively. This comes after PMC Commissioner Vikram Kumar inspected the bad condition of the roads after receiving complaints from people.

277.title: Violence reported between 2 communities in Kolkata; Section 144 imposed
277.article_body: A clash broke out between two communities at Mominpur in Kolkata on the night of October 8 over Milad-un-Nabi flags. Many houses in the Mayurbhanj area were ransacked and cars were destroyed the next day. Prohibitory orders under Section 144 have been imposed in the Ekbalpur area till October 12 in view of the law and order situation.

278.title: Not right to pit films against each other: Vikram Vedha directors on 'Ponniyin...'
278.article_body: Director duo Pushkar and Gayathri said the release of 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' has not affected the box office collection of their film 'Vikram Vedha'. "I don't think the presence of another big film is going to hurt either one of the movies majorly...it's not right to pit movies against each other," they added. Both films had released on September 30.

279.title: Name of Shinde & his MLAs will be written in ‘black ink’: Sena
279.article_body: Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, in an editorial in its mouthpiece 'Samaana', said that the name of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and his MLAs will be written in "black ink". Shiv Sena on Monday said that it is a bushfire that can never be extinguished and promised to bounce back from EC's decision to freeze the party's name and symbol.

280.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 with over 2,600 kg of illegal crackers
280.article_body: Delhi Police's Crime Branch has arrested two men and seized 2,625 kg of illegal firecrackers from their possession, which were to be sold during the upcoming festival season, officials said on Monday. Police said that one of the accused had been in the firecrackers business since 2018, while the other had been working since 2020 and got paid ₹12,000.

281.title: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin asks Centre to treat all languages equally
281.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin warned the Centre against the imposition of the Hindi language and asked the government to treat all languages equally. "India has unity in diversity...We should come to a level where all languages are official languages...We urge the Prime Minister and government to stop Hindi imposition and save India's unity," said Stalin.

282.title: Sanjay Raut's custody extended till October 17 in land scam case
282.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut's judicial custody has been extended till October 17 in connection with the Patra Chawl land scam case. He was arrested by the ED on August 1 after over six hours of questioning in the ₹1,034-crore case. Earlier in August, Raut’s wife was also questioned by the probe agency in connection with the same case.

283.title: Dharmendra shares pic from 'Sholay', calls Big B 'most talented actor'
283.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra Deol took to Twitter and shared an old picture with actor Amitabh Bachchan from 'Sholay'. "I got news from Rajshri Productions that you're doing a film ('Uunchai') with them...Most talented actor and the best production house together," Dharmendra tweeted along with the photo. Dharmendra further wished Amitabh for 'Uunchai', which is directed by Sooraj Barjatya.

284.title: Iranian drones used in Russia's attack on Ukraine: Zelenskyy
284.article_body: After Russia bombed multiple Ukrainian cities on Monday, the country's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that dozens of missiles and Iranian drones were used in the attack which targeted civilians and energy facilities. The timing and goals of the explosions "were specially chosen to cause as much damage as possible", he added. He also urged people to stay in shelters today.

285.title: It takes two to tango: Shreyas to Ishan who missed his ton in India's win vs SA
285.article_body: Reacting to Ishan Kishan expressing disappointment for not scoring a hundred in the second South Africa ODI, Shreyas Iyer praised the 24-year-old and said, "We won the match...it takes two to tango, you'll get one in the next game." Ishan had said, "What do you have to say about scoring a hundred, meanwhile I missed [mine] at my home ground."

286.title: Tabu, Kriti Sanon joins Kareena in Rhea Kapoor's comedy film: Report
286.article_body: Tabu and Kriti Sanon will reportedly share screen space with Kareena Kapoor Khan in Rhea Kapoor's upcoming comedy film. The project will mark Kareena's first collaboration with Kriti and Tabu. Talking about the movie, Kareena had previously shared that she's "super excited" about the film, which she said is "slightly different" than Rhea's previous production venture, 'Veere Di Wedding'.

287.title: Sajid flashed his private part at me, asked me to rate it on 0 to 10 scale: Sherlyn Chopra
287.article_body: Actress Sherlyn Chopra took to Twitter and alleged that filmmaker Sajid Khan had flashed his "private part" at her and asked her to rate it on a scale of 0 to 10. She added, "I’d like to enter into the house of Big Boss and give him the rating! Let India watch how a survivor deals with her molester!"

288.title: School manager in UP sends obscene messages, pics to woman; booked
288.article_body: An FIR has been registered against the manager of a private school in UP for allegedly sending obscene photographs and messages to a woman, police said on Sunday. The woman's father alleged that the accused sent obscene photographs and messages on her daughter's phone on October 5, said Manoj Kumar Singh, Station House Officer, Ujhani.

289.title: Armed confrontation is not an option: Taiwanese Prez to China
289.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Monday said that she wants to "make it clear" to authorities in China that "armed confrontation is absolutely not an option". She also said that it's "regrettable" that China has escalated military tensions and threatened the peace and stability in the Taiwan Strait and the region. Ing-wen made the remarks during her National Day address.

290.title: Apple iPhone 5c to be added to obsolete product list on Nov 1: Report
290.article_body: Apple iPhone 5c will be added to the obsolete product list on November 1, resulting in discontinuation of all service programs for the model, according to reports. The firm sent a memo to authorised Apple resellers mentioning the same. Apple's memo also states that the third-generation iPad mini with Wi-Fi and TD-LTE will also be marked 'obsolete' on November 1.

291.title: Video shows journalist ducking for cover live on air as missiles hit Ukraine's Kyiv
291.article_body: A video showing the moment a BBC journalist ducked for cover during a live broadcast which was interrupted as Russian missiles hit Ukraine's Kyiv on Monday, has gone viral. The reporter, Hugo Bachega, could be seen rushing to take shelter after hearing the sound of a missile overhead. BBC said it re-established contact with the journalist over an hour later.

292.title: Would die on spot if I ever encounter a ghost: Katrina Kaif
292.article_body: Katrina Kaif said she "would die on the spot" if she'd ever encounter a ghost in real life. Katrina plays a ghost in 'Phone Bhoot', which also stars Ishaan Khatter and Siddhant Chaturvedi. When asked who'd she haunt if she was a ghost for a day, Katrina said she'd haunt Priyanka Chopra "to see how she does so much work".

293.title: Delhi reports more than 300 cases of Dengue in first 5 days of Oct
293.article_body: Delhi has reported a rise in dengue cases as 321 people were diagnosed with the infection in the first five days of October, data showed. Delhi reported 693 dengue cases in the month of September, taking the national capital's total tally to 1,258 so far this year. However, no dengue-related deaths have been reported in Delhi this year till now.

294.title: ED moves SC against HC order quashing probe against Indiabulls
294.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has moved the Supreme Court (SC) to challenge the Delhi High Court's (HC) order quashing a probe against home finance firm Indiabulls. According to ED, Indiabulls loaned money to entities to increase its stocks' market price. The Delhi HC had quashed the ED probe against Indiabulls and held that no coercive action be taken against the firm.

295.title: Manmohan Singh writes condolence letter to Akhilesh on Mulayam Singh's demise
295.article_body: Former PM Manmohan Singh wrote condolence letter to SP chief Akhilesh Yadav on demise of his father Mulayam Singh Yadav. In the letter, Singh wrote, "He was a leader of high esteem who was respected by everybody irrespective of party lines." "My wife joins me to convey to you and other members of your family our deepest condolences," he added.

296.title: Mulayam Singh used to respect all religions, fight for them: Farooq Abdullah
296.article_body: Condoling the demise of Samajwadi Party founder and ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav, National Conference chief Farooq Abdullah said he was a people's leader. "He used to respect all religions and fight for them. There's no person in India who wouldn't be grieved on this day," Abdullah added. "He devoted all his life for the welfare of poor," he stated.

297.title: PM lays foundation stone for projects worth ₹8,000 crore in Gujarat
297.article_body: PM Modi laid the foundation stone of various development projects in Gujarat worth over ₹8,000 crore and lauded the progress of the Bharuch region over the years. "Once Bharuch was known only for salted peanuts, today it is flourishing in industry and trade," said the PM. He also praised the setting up of the first drug park in Bharuch.

298.title: Troll says 'RRR' will win Oscar for 'best cringe movie', Vishnu Manchu reacts
298.article_body: Actor Vishnu Manchu, known for his work in Telugu cinema and television, has responded to a Twitter user who wrote, "Is there any category called best cringe movie? If yes then definitely 'RRR' will win Oscar in that category." "Why don't we celebrate Indian cinema my brother? Now it ain't about regional pride but national pride," Vishnu wrote.

299.title: 26-yr-old autorickshaw driver stabbed in Pune, 3 friends arrested
299.article_body: Hours after a 26-year-old auto-rickshaw driver was found murdered in Pune, police on Saturday arrested three of his friends for allegedly stabbing him to death following a dispute. Senior Inspector Abhay Mahajan said the deceased had used insulting words towards the accused in an inebriated condition, following which they stabbed him to death.

300.title: Death toll from boat capsize in Nigeria rises to 76
300.article_body: The death toll from a boat tragedy in Nigeria's Anambra state has risen to 76, the country's President Muhammadu Buhari said on Sunday. The boat capsized on Friday amid heavy flooding in the Ogbaru area of Anambra, as per local authorities. Earlier on Saturday, authorities had reported 10 people dead and 60 others missing.

301.title: Apple AirPods to be manufactured in India, says IT Ministry: Report
301.article_body: Apple's AirPods will be manufactured in India, said a report quoting IT Ministry. This comes after Apple announced its plans to start manufacturing iPhone 14 in India. As per the report, the iPhone 14 will be manufactured by December 2022 at Foxconn's facility near Chennai. The company is already manufacturing iPhone 13 in India.

302.title: Filmmaker Karan Johar quits Twitter, deletes his account
302.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar today deleted his Twitter account after announcing he's quitting the platform. In a tweet posted at 3 pm, he wrote, "Making space for more positive energies only and this is step one towards that...Goodbye Twitter!" Reacting to his decision, a Twitter user wrote, "Please stay...Karan." Another tweet read, "Focus on your mental health and 'Brahmastra 2'...Sending positivity."

303.title: We are not in Premier League title race: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp
303.article_body: After their 2-3 defeat against Arsenal in the Premier League on Sunday, Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp said that they are not in the race for the Premier League title anymore. "We have problems at the moment," admitted Klopp after the match. Liverpool are currently placed 10th on the points table, with two wins from eight matches so far.

304.title: RBI sells dollars as rupee hits record low on fears of US rate hike: Report
304.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India have reportedly sold dollars via state-run banks on Monday after Rupee fell to a record low of 82.6825. The fall came following a US jobs report that suggested more aggressive rate hikes. "The RBI activity, in our opinion, is not more aggressive than in recent days," a spot dealer at a private sector bank said.

305.title: 300-vehicle convoy carries Mulayam's body to his native place in UP; video surfaces
305.article_body: A convoy of 300 vehicles carried the body of SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav to his native place in Uttar Pradesh's Saifai. A video that has surfaced on social media showed the convoy passing through the Yamuna Expressway, while people were seen showering flowers on some of the cars. Mulayam Singh Yadav passed away on Monday after a prolonged illness.

306.title: Big B's fans dance to 'Don' song in theatre, Shabana shares video
306.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi has shared a video showing people dancing to the title song of Amitabh Bachchan's 1978 film 'Don' in a Mumbai theatre. The film was screened on Saturday as a part of 'Bachchan Back To The Beginning', a film festival organised by Film Heritage Foundation and PVR Cinemas to celebrate Amitabh's 80th birthday. "What a treat," Shabana wrote.

307.title: Russian troops advancing towards Ukrainian town of Bakhmut: UK
307.article_body: Russian forces are advancing towards Bakhmut, which is considered a strategically important town in eastern Ukraine, a British intelligence update said on Monday. Russian troops have come 2 km closer to the town in the last week, the communique added. Bakhmut sits on the main road leading to the cities of Sloviansk and Kramatorsk in the Donbas region.

308.title: Villagers in Saifai recall locals skipping meal in 1967 for Mulayam Singh
308.article_body: People of Saifai, which is the native village of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, recalled incident of 1967 Assembly elections, on his demise. Sharing the incident, they said that a meeting of the entire village was called and it was decided that they will skip one meal a day to ensure that Yadav's car can run for eight days.

309.title: CCTV video shows UP policeman stealing sleeping man's phone, police respond
309.article_body: A CCTV video has surfaced showing a police constable stealing the phone of a man sleeping on a cot by the roadside during his night patrol in UP's Kanpur. Reacting to the video, Additional Superintendent of Police, Kanpur Outer, said that the accused constable Prigesh Kumar has been suspended. Police said that prima facie the allegation appears to be true.

310.title: 'Netaji' was an emotion for people of UP: Kumar Vishvas on Mulayam Singh’s demise
310.article_body: Poet Dr Kumar Vishvas expressed grief on the demise of Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav. "You may agree or disagree with his political decisions but for us, people of UP, he wasn't a person but an emotion," Vishvas tweeted. "An era of understanding of land and people...has ended," he added.

311.title: Ukraine conflict does not serve interests of anybody: Jaishankar
311.article_body: On being questioned about the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Monday said, "We believe that this conflict does not serve the interests of anybody, neither the participants nor indeed of the international community." He also declined to predict if India will support or abstain from a draft resolution against Russia in UN General Assembly.

312.title: Reliance, Jio aim to raise $1.5 billion and $2.5 billion, respectively: Report
312.article_body: Reliance Industries Ltd (RIL) and Jio are in talks with lenders to raise up to $1.5 and $2.5 billion, respectively in foreign loans, Economic Times reported. RIL will reportedly raise funds to support its capital expenditure plan. Jio is in talks with Bank of America, BNP, HSBC, and Societe Generale to purchase 5G network gear from Ericsson and Nokia.

313.title: Delhi Police integrate its licensing services with DigiLocker
313.article_body: Delhi Police has integrated its licensing services with DigiLocker. With this, citizens will be able to keep their licences, including arms, eating and lodging house licence, in digital form in the DigiLocker app from now on, said Sanjay Singh, Special Commissioner (Licensing and Legal Division). "Enforcing agencies too will have an authentic source for verification of such licenses," he added.

314.title: 2 arrested for cheating hotel management students in Pune
314.article_body: The Pune Police arrested two people for allegedly defrauding students of hotel management on fake assurances of employment at hotels in foreign countries. According to the police, the two accused were running a private career consultancy service and allegedly took ₹4.5 lakh from the complainant on the pretext of providing the assured job.

315.title: Gurugram Police arrest 2 men for assaulting cops, hospital staff
315.article_body: Gurugram Police arrested two men from Delhi for allegedly assaulting policemen and hospital staffers in Sohna last week. The suspects, Manish (27) and Sandeep (25), allegedly assaulted employees at a private hospital and later attacked policemen who came to the staffers' rescue. There are already three cases registered against Manish for snatching and possession of illegal weapons, police said.

316.title: I think 2022 T20 WC final would be between WI and Australia: Chris Gayle
316.article_body: Veteran West Indies cricketer Chris Gayle has said the final of the upcoming T20 WC could be played between West Indies and Australia. Gayle, however, also added that it'll be difficult for West Indies as there's "no Kieron Pollard, Andre Russell and Bravo in the team". "It's just a matter of adapting your strategy in the right way," stated Gayle.

317.title: Urban naxals trying to enter Guj, state will destroy them: PM Modi
317.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said that "urban naxals" were trying to gain entry into Gujarat by changing their appearance but the state will not allow them to "destroy the lives of youth". "They have changed their costumes. They are misleading our innocent and energetic youth into following them," PM Modi added. "Gujarat will destroy them," he stated.

318.title: Doctor harasses 19-yr-old B'luru student; teams formed to nab him
318.article_body: Special teams have been formed to apprehend a doctor who allegedly sexually harassed a 19-year-old student when she visited his clinic in Bengaluru's Chandra Layout in last week of September and first week of October. She accused the doctor touched her inappropriately. The matter came to light when the student's mother asked her to consult the doctor and she refused.

319.title: Tata Motors shares fall 4.6% after fall in Jaguar Land Rover wholesale volumes
319.article_body: Shares of Tata Motors fell by 4.6% on Monday after Tata revealed that its Jaguar Land Rover (JLR) business wholesale volumes fell below expectations. JLR wholesale volumes were 75,307 for the second quarter against the projected volumes of 90,000. The automaker blamed lower-than-expected supply of specialised semiconductor chips from one supplier for failing to meet its target.

320.title: Ben Bernanke, Douglas Diamond and Philip Dybvig awarded 2022 Nobel Prize in Economics
320.article_body: The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences has awarded 2022 Sveriges Riksbank Prize in Economic Sciences in Memory of Alfred Nobel to Ben S Bernanke, Douglas W Diamond and Philip H Dybvig. They have been given the award "for research on banks and financial crises". A prize money of 10 million Swedish kronor (₹7.29 crore) will be shared among the trio.

321.title: Uddhav-led Sena will 'rise like phoenix' after present turmoil: MLA
321.article_body: MLA Bhaskar Yadav of the Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena said that the present turmoil in the party is just a passing phase and expressed confidence that Sena will "rise again like a phoenix". Shiv Sena deputy leader Sushma Andhare claimed that CM Shinde was just a puppet in the hands of the BJP.

322.title: Pune University students protest against 'excessive' fee hike
322.article_body: Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has increased fees for various courses, leading to protests by several student organisations. Principal Dr Rajendra Zunjarrao said the students are comparing this year's fees to last year's when the college had decreased the actual fees due to the pandemic. The students are demanding a rollback of the "excessive" fee hike.

323.title: Shreyas has been magnificent, you might see him in that XI for ODI WC: Jaffer
323.article_body: Ex-cricketer Wasim Jaffer has praised batter Shreyas Iyer for his performance in recent ODIs, stating that the 27-year-old might "squeeze in" somewhere in India's playing XI for the 2023 ODI World Cup. "Shreyas has been magnificent. In his last six ODI innings, he has got four fifties and one hundred," added Jaffer. Shreyas slammed 113*(111) in the second SA ODI.

324.title: I change approach based on instinct, not the bowler: Shreyas on 113*
324.article_body: Discussing his unbeaten 113 off 111 balls in the second ODI against South Africa, Team India batter Shreyas Iyer said, "I am not someone who changes according to the bowler. I...change [based] on [my] instinct." "It's not something I try in [the] nets first, I change it in the match itself," added Shreyas. Shreyas' unbeaten 113 comprised 15 fours.

325.title: SP worker breaks down over Mulayam Singh's death, video surfaces
325.article_body: A Samajwadi Party worker broke down after the demise of party's founder Mulayam Singh Yadav on Monday. A video of him breaking down outside Gurugram's Medanta hospital, where Yadav passed away aged 82, has surfaced online. In the video, he could be seen crying inconsolably and saying, "We were praying...for Netaji's health. This news (of his demise) is very sad."

326.title: 'Is this court's job?': Supreme Court on plea to declare cow as national animal
326.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday refused to entertain a plea that sought the court direct the government to declare cow as a national animal. A bench of Justices SK Kaul and Abhay S Oka asked the petitioner, "Is this the job of the court? Which fundamental right is violated?" The plea was withdrawn after the court warned of imposing costs.

327.title: India's Oscar entry 'Chhello Show' tickets to be sold for ₹95
327.article_body: India's official Oscar entry 'Chhello Show' will be screened a day early than its official release date in 95 theaters, with tickets priced at ₹95. Confirming the news, director Pan Nalin said, "What better way to celebrate its ['Chhello Show'] selection at the 95th Oscars than by releasing it in 95 cinemas at a wonderful price of ₹95."

328.title: Shinde submits 'Talwar' & 'Gada' as choices after EC freezes Sena symbol
328.article_body: Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena submitted 'Tutari' (trumpet), 'Talwar' (sword) and 'Gada' (blunt mace) as alternatives, days after EC forbade both Sena factions to use the party name and symbol. The Uddhav-led faction on Sunday submitted 'Trishul', a 'Mashal' and 'Rising Sun' as symbol choices. The 40-headed Ravana froze the bow and arrow of Lord Ram, Uddhav said.

329.title: Private tourist buses in Pune being checked after Nashik accident
329.article_body: The Regional Transport Offices in the Pune district have launched a drive to check violations by private operators. This comes after a private tourist bus caught fire after colliding with a truck in Nashik. RTO officials said that they are also checking if the buses are carrying more passengers than allowed.

330.title: We'll build a statue of Messi outside Camp Nou: Barca Prez Laporta
330.article_body: Barcelona President Joan Laporta said the club has decided to build a statue of Lionel Messi outside Camp Nou. Messi joined PSG in 2021 after spending 21 years at Barcelona, having failed to renew his contract. "It's the saddest decision I've had to make," Laporta had said while discussing his exit. Messi is Barcelona's all-time top scorer with 672 goals.

331.title: DCW chief lists 10 MeToo complaints against Sajid Khan, seeks his removal from Bigg Boss
331.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women Chairperson Swati Maliwal has written to I&B Minister Anurag Thakur, seeking filmmaker Sajid Khan's removal from Bigg Boss 16 over multiple sexual harassment allegations against him. Maliwal listed 10 MeToo allegations by models, actresses and journalists against Sajid and wrote, "All these complaints show the disgusting mentality of Sajid."

332.title: Tom Cruise to become 1st actor to shoot in outer space: Report
332.article_body: Hollywood star Tom Cruise will reportedly be the first actor to shoot in outer space. "We have a great project in development with Cruise...Taking a rocket up to the Space Station and shooting," Universal Filmed Entertainment Group Chairman Donna Langley told BBC News. As per NY Post, the project will be directed by filmmaker Doug Liman.

333.title: PM Modi to inaugurate Terminal 2 of Bengaluru airport in November
333.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the newly constructed Terminal 2 of Bengaluru's Kempegowda International Airport on November 10. "I invite all of you to participate in the event to make it a grand success," CM Basavaraj Bommai told BJP workers while addressing a party event. Terminal 2 is being built in two phases at a cost of ₹13,000 crore.

334.title: Delhi's garment shop owner returning from work shot dead, CCTVs being scanned
334.article_body: Two bike-borne men allegedly killed a garment shop owner in Delhi's Bindapur, reports said. The victim was returning from his shop along with his brother on a scooter when they were intercepted by the men. One of them shot the victim before the two ran away. Police said CCTV cameras in the area are being scanned as part of investigation.

335.title: Vicky's reaction to 'Phone Bhoot' trailer gave us much confidence: Katrina
335.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif said Vicky Kaushal "absolutely loved" the trailer of her upcoming film 'Phone Bhoot' and it's his reaction that gave the team "much confidence" about the film. "He feels that there are so many fun elements in it and people would love it. That's our hope too," she added. 'Phone Bhoot' also stars Siddhant Chaturvedi and Ishaan Khatter.

336.title: Vegetarian crocodile that lived in Kerala temple pond for over 70 years dies
336.article_body: A vegetarian crocodile which had been living in a temple pond in Kerala's Kasaragod district for more than seven decades died on Sunday. Hundreds of devotees paid homage to the crocodile, named Babiya, when its body was placed on the premises of Sree Ananthapadmanabha Swamy Temple. The temple has no records that indicate how Babiya reached its pond.

337.title: Last rites of Mulayam Singh Yadav to be held tomorrow in Saifai at 3 pm
337.article_body: Last rites of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav will be held on Tuesday in Uttar Pradesh's Saifai at 3 pm, the party's official Twitter account posted on Monday. Yadav passed away on Monday after undergoing treatment at Gurugram's Medanta Hospital for several days. His son and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav confirmed the news of his death on Monday morning.

338.title: PM Modi expresses grief over Temsula Ao's demise, says her efforts noteworthy
338.article_body: PM Narendra Modi mourned the death of renowned Indian poet Temsula Ao and said that the Padma Shri recipient played an important role in popularising the Naga culture through her literary works. "Her efforts in the fields of education and culture were noteworthy. Condolences to her family and friends. May her soul rest in peace," the Prime Minister tweeted.

339.title: He devoted his life to UP, nation: Piyush Goyal on Mulayam Singh's demise
339.article_body: Condoling the demise of Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said he devoted his life to Uttar Pradesh and the nation. "Netaji was dear to all…His demise is a great loss to the country," Goyal added. "His contributions to the nation will be remembered for many years to come," he added.

340.title: Mondrian's rare painting expected to fetch over ₹412 crore at auction
340.article_body: A painting by Dutch artist Piet Mondrian, titled 'Composition No. Il', is expected to fetch over ₹412 crore (over $50 million), according to auction house Sotheby's. "Works by Mondrian with a predominance of red are exceptionally rare," Sotheby's said. "It is also one of only three paintings to feature the dominant red square at the upper right," it added.

341.title: Pic of Ronaldo's unique celebration after his 700th club goal goes viral
341.article_body: A picture of Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo's unique celebration after he scored his 700th club goal during a Premier League match against Everton has gone viral. In the picture, Ronaldo and his teammate Antony can be seen with eyes closed and hands on their chests. Ronaldo's first Premier League goal of the season helped Manchester United beat Everton 2-1.

342.title: Delhi Police busts gangs cheating public using fake calls, websites
342.article_body: Delhi Police Cyber Crime Unit (IFSO) has busted three gangs and arrested 12 persons who used to allegedly cheat people by offering franchisees or services of leading firms using fake calls, websites and emails, among others. This comes after the Delhi High Court referred to the IFSO unit over matters regarding trademark and copyright violations relating to leading companies.

343.title: One faction doesn't want to leave CM's chair in Raj, other wants to grab it: Raje
343.article_body: Former Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje on Sunday said while one faction in Congress government in the state does not want to leave the Chief Minister's “chair", the other is adamant to "grab it". Furthermore, she said, "People in the Congress government are least concerned about the public." She added that CM Ashok Gehlot is an expert in making false promises.

344.title: 7 lakes supplying drinking water to Mumbai 97.44% full
344.article_body: Seven lakes that supply drinking water to Mumbai are 97.44 per cent full and have 14,10,274 million litres (ML) of water stocked as on October 9. With this, the city now has water stocked for the next one year. The seven lakes that supply drinking water to Mumbai include Upper Vaitarna, Modak Sagar, Tansa, Middle Vaitarna, Bhatsa, Vihar and Tulsi.

345.title: Russia launched 75 missiles, says Ukraine as multiple blasts leave 5 dead
345.article_body: Several loud blasts, appearing to be coordinated attacks, were heard across different cities in Ukraine on Monday. The Ukrainian military's head said Russia launched at least 75 missiles on Monday. The explosions, which have killed at least five people and injured 12, came a day after Moscow blamed Ukraine for the explosion on a bridge linking Crimea to Russia.

346.title: Mulayam Singh Yadav was a big name in Indian politics: HP CM Jairam Thakur
346.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Chief Minister Jairam Thakur has expressed his "deepest condolences" to the family members and supporters of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, who passed away earlier in the day. "He was a big name in Indian politics. This is a great loss for the politics of the country," stated Thakur. Mulayam Singh passed away aged 82.

347.title: Man kills 2 men for confronting him for harassing woman in Pune neighbourhood
347.article_body: Pune Police are looking to catch a man for allegedly stabbing to death two men aged 24 and 27 after they confronted him about harassing a woman in their neighbourhood. Reports said that the accused had allegedly broken the glass of the woman's bathroom window on Saturday. When confronted by the victims about the same, the suspect stabbed them.

348.title: Cyberabad police shares video of person thanking staff amid rains
348.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Sunday shared a video of a person thanking its personnel for working amid heavy rains, saying, "These words give immense satisfaction, which can't be expressed in words."
