In the video, the person can be heard asking the traffic police personnel's name and saying, "Thank you very much sir for doing [a] great job in such rain."

349.title: In pics: Wrestler, teacher, 3-time UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's journey
349.article_body: Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, who served as Uttar Pradesh CM thrice and also served as Union Defence Minister, passed away on Monday aged 82. Yadav started his career as a teacher at Jain Inter College in Mainpuri district and also used to dabble in wrestling in his youth. He became an MLA for the first time at 27.

350.title: Jhunjhunwala once said 'I don't have money, I'll wash dishes': Mumbai pub's manager
350.article_body: Late billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala once asked the waiter of a Mumbai pub to show him the way to kitchen when he was presented with the bill. Jhunjhunwala said 'I don't have so much money, I will wash dishes', Geoffrey's manager recalled. On another occasion, Jhunjhunwala forgot to pay the bill and sent 50% more than bill amount next day.

351.title: Girl recording video captures the moment missile hit across the street in Ukraine
351.article_body: A girl recording video in Ukrainian capital of Kyiv captured the moment a missile hit across the street. Ukraine has accused Russia of launching missile strikes across the country on Monday which have left several wounded and dead. Several pictures and videos from Ukraine showed buildings and vehicles on fire after the attack.

352.title: We don't have Messi sitting on the bench: PCB's Raja on criticism over selection
352.article_body: Reacting to criticism of their middle order in recent matches, PCB chief Ramiz Raja defended the team selection, stating that they have "limited options" and there's "no Lionel Messi sitting on the bench". "My philosophy in cricket is...we need consistency in selection and second we need to strengthen the skipper," stated Raja. "We haven't picked [any] worthless player," he added.

353.title: CBI arrests Hyderabad lobbyist in Delhi excise policy case
353.article_body: Another person has been arrested by the CBI in the Delhi excise policy case for allegedly lobbying for a South India-based businessman. The accused has been identified as Abhishek Boinpally, who is a resident of Hyderabad. The probe agency found him to be evading key questions. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia has also been named in the case.

354.title: Suvendu Adhikari demands deployment of central forces in West Bengal
354.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari wrote to Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Governor La Ganesan, demanding the urgent deployment of central forces after violence in Mominpur. "The Hindu community has come under attack on the eve of Lakshmi Puja...The onslaught has similarities to the Panchla violence, which happened in June in the Uluberia area of Howrah district," wrote Adhikari.

355.title: Mulayam Singh was true warrior associated with grassroots politics: Rahul
355.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi paid tributes to Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav on his demise. "Mulayam Singh Yadav was a true warrior associated with grassroots politics," Gandhi tweeted. "I express my deepest condolences to all the bereaved family members including Akhilesh Yadav," he added. Congress' Priyanka Gandhi also condoled Yadav's demise.

356.title: Hyd to get India's first residential sky deck project in Raidurgam
356.article_body: Hyderabad is going to get India's first sky deck residential project as a Telangana-based construction company announced the launch of its first such project in Raidurgam. As per the press release of Raghava Constructions, the project consists of three towers, each with 45 floors, and is spread across 7.38 acres. It is inspired by Singapore's Marina Bay, the company added.

357.title: India will have high-speed rail before US, it's a safe bet: Zoho's billionaire CEO
357.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu said it is a "safe bet" that India will have high-speed rail between major metros before US. Vembu was commenting on a report on the collapse of high-speed rail in California. Stating that US is losing will to govern, Vembu tweeted, "India has 25x lower per capita GDP but has the will to govern herself."

358.title: Bihar government announces 1-day state mourning on Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise
358.article_body: The Bihar government has announced a one-day state mourning on Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise on Monday. The SP founder passed away on Monday after undergoing treatment at Medanta Hospital in Gurugram for several days. His son and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav confirmed the news of his death on the party's Twitter page.

359.title: Russia trying to wipe us off: Ukraine as blasts reported across the country
359.article_body: Several explosions have been reported across Ukraine amid war with Russia. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that many people have been left dead and wounded in the explosions, adding, "They (Russia) are trying to destroy us and wipe us off the face of the Earth." This comes after Russian President Vladimir Putin called Crimean bridge blast a 'terrorist act'.

360.title: Hrithik to spend time with IAF officers to prep for 'Fighter': Report
360.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan will reportedly spend time with Air Force officers as a part of preparation for his role in 'Fighter'. As per a report, Hrithik is playing an Indian Air Force pilot in the film, which will also star Deepika Padukone. 'Fighter' is touted to be India's first aerial action film, which will release on September 28, 2023.

361.title: Mulayam Singh's death is saddening, we had familiar relations: Lalu
361.article_body: RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav condoled the demise of former UP CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. "Netaji is no more among us. Mulayam Singh Yadav had an important contribution in taking forward the socialist movement. We had familiar relations with him. The news of his demise is very saddening for us," he said.

362.title: 2 killed, 21 injured as lightning strikes them during football match in Odisha
362.article_body: At least two persons were killed and 21 others were injured when lightning struck them during a football match in Odisha's Sundargarh. Among the deceased was a football player while most of the injured were spectators. Police said that even though the sky was cloudy, there was no rain in the area when lightning struck the playground.

363.title: Srihari accuses IndiGo staff of bad behaviour, says 'Should we leave medals at venue?'
363.article_body: Indian swimmer Srihari Nataraj took to Twitter to criticise IndiGo staff for behaving badly with him and his teammates after they were returning from National Games. He stated they also charged hefty amount for excess baggage which included their medals. He wrote, "Honestly...the amount wasn't an issue...it's the way they treated [us]. Should we leave...medals we win back at...venue?"

364.title: AIMIM will run for all UP seats in future elections: Party's state chief
364.article_body: UP AIMIM President Shaukat Ali confirmed that the party will run for all seats in future Assembly elections. He also claimed that many SP leaders will join the AIMIM in the coming days. "People are coming towards AIMIM now. We are contesting in East UP, Purvanchal, Central UP and Bundelkhand," said Shaukat Ali.

365.title: Axis Bank awards work-from-anywhere staff higher performance ratings, promotions
365.article_body: Axis Bank has said that its employees working from anywhere were awarded higher performance ratings and promotions as compared to the overall staff population. The bank’s HR Head Rajkamal Vempati said, "In the WFA cohort, we see lower attrition and higher performance." Currently,  30% of its eligible workforce is working in alternate mode.

366.title: 'Indian 2' makers aiming for Dussehra or Diwali release in 2023: Report
366.article_body: The makers of 'Indian 2' are reportedly aiming to release the Kamal Haasan film on Dussehra or Diwali next year. As per a report, the team of the Shankar directorial will wrap up the project by March 2023. It is said to be a pan-Indian film, which will release in Telugu, Tamil, Hindi, Malayalam and Kannada.

367.title: N Korea confirms missile launches were 'tactical nuclear drills'
367.article_body: North Korea's recent missile launches were tactical nuclear drills which were guided by the country's leader Kim Jong-un, state media KCNA reported on Monday. It said that through the drills the "actual war capabilities" of the nuclear war forces which are "ready to hit and wipe out...set objects at any location and any time were displayed to the full".

368.title: Amit Shah reaches Medanta Hospital to pay last respects to Mulayam Singh, pics surface
368.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah visited Gurugram's Medanta Hospital where SP founder Mulayam Singh Yadav died on Monday and paid his last respects. He met Yadav's family, including his son and former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav, and expressed his condolences. Shah tweeted, "Due to the death of Mulayam Singh Yadav, a huge vacuum has emerged in Uttar Pradesh and national politics."

369.title: Wheelchair-bound Russian man with spinal issue called to fight in war; pic surfaces
369.article_body: A wheelchair-bound Russian has allegedly been called up to fight in war against Ukraine as part of the conscription drive. Oleg Vasiliev, who suffers from spinal muscular atrophy, has been told to report to his local draft office, a letter of which has also surfaced. Russian Paralympian Dmitry Ignatov was reportedly also called to an enlistment office.

370.title: Several explosions hit Ukraine's capital city Kyiv's centre: Mayor
370.article_body: Several explosions hit the centre of Ukraine's capital city Kyiv on Monday, the city's Mayor said. The city's emergency service's spokesperson told Associated Press that people have been killed and wounded. "What is Russia trying to hit? The national university? The park? Or...playground?" Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko said as she shared a picture of at least one of the explosions.

371.title: Helicopter service to Bengaluru airport to be launched today, details shared
371.article_body: Helicopter service from Bengaluru Airport to Bengaluru city will be launched today. BLADE India, the company that is handling the service, shared details of the initiative on its website, "You can now get to Bengaluru City Center in under 15 mins from BLADE helipad in BK Halli, Hennur, a 10 min car ride from the Airport terminal," the company said.

372.title: Irreparable loss for country: President Murmu on Mulayam Singh's demise
372.article_body: Condoling the demise of Samajwadi Party (SP) founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, President Droupadi Murmu said that it's an irreparable loss for the country. "The achievements of Mulayam Singh Yadav Ji, who came from an ordinary environment, were extraordinary," President Murmu tweeted. "He was respected by people of all parties. My deepest condolences to his family members and supporters," she added.

373.title: Harbhajan was very supportive: Geeta Basra on her acting comeback
373.article_body: Geeta Basra said Harbhajan Singh "was very supportive" about her decision to make her acting comeback. "He thought it was great that I'm planning on going back to work and he told me that we'll find a way to take care of the kids," she said. Geeta will be seen in 'Notary', which marks her first film in six years.

374.title: 2 women pose as sex workers to stop man, rob him in Delhi; arrested
374.article_body: Two women, aged 25 and 28, were arrested after they allegedly assaulted and robbed a man of his gold ring in Delhi, police said. An officer said that the women posed as sex workers to stop the man, who was riding a motorcycle. "[The man] said while one woman grabbed his neck, the second one robbed...gold ring," the officer added.

375.title: 64-yr-old Mumbai man loses ₹17.80 lakh over nude video call
375.article_body: A 64-year-old Mumbai man lost ₹17.80 lakh in a 'sextortion' scam. The man received a nude video call from a woman who recorded the video with him in frame and later blackmailed him demanding money. On refusing to send money, he later received call from fraudster posing as Delhi Police officer who demanded money to save him from getting arrested.

376.title: Uddhav is nothing, Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray makes me important: Ex-Maha CM
376.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Sunday said, "Uddhav is nothing, it's Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray and this is what makes me important." Furthermore, he said, "I still remember Shiv Sena foundation day on June 19, 1966, when Sena was formed at Shivaji Park...Balasaheb used to take up issues of Marathi Manoos through Marmik weekly."

377.title: Congress to organise foot marches across Karnataka ahead of 2023 polls
377.article_body: The Congress party claimed that it would organise foot marches across Karnataka to reach out to all sections of society ahead of the 2023 Assembly polls. "We will undertake yatras in the state covering all three regions and every constituency and will reach out to people to highlight the failures of this 40% commission government," said Congress leader Randeep Surjewala.

378.title: Adani Group in talks to buy Jaiprakash's cement unit for ₹5,000 crore: Report
378.article_body: Adani Group is in advanced talks to buy debt-laden Jaiprakash Power Ventures' cement unit and other smaller assets for about ₹5,000 crore, Bloomberg reported. Notably, the Gautam Adani-led conglomerate recently bought Ambuja Cements and ACC from Switzerland's Holcim, becoming India's second-largest cement maker. The acquisition of Jaiprakash's cement unit will be made either by Ambuja or ACC.

379.title: Lift moves up as man tries to enter, almost cuts off his head in Russia; video surfaces
379.article_body: A CCTV footage has surfaced online showing an elevator moving up as man tried to enter it and almost cutting off his head in Russia's Krasnodar. The video shows the man looking at his phone as he walks into the elevator, while the doors close around him. The man can be seen diving backwards to save himself.

380.title: That's 35 goals a season for 20 yrs: Lineker on Ronaldo's 700 club goals
380.article_body: Ex-England footballer Gary Lineker praised Ronaldo on scripting history by becoming the first player to score 700 club goals in top-level football, terming him as "incredible" on Twitter. "That is 35 goals a season for 20 years. Ridiculous!" added Lineker in his tweet. Ronaldo reached the milestone following his goal in a Premier League match against Everton.

381.title: Mulayam Singh Yadav was grassroots leader, played important role in UP: Rajnath Singh
381.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh paid tributes to Samajwadi Party founder and former Uttar Pradesh CM Mulayam Singh Yadav on his demise. He tweeted, "Shri Mulayam Singh Yadav ji was a grassroots leader who played a prominent role in the politics of Uttar Pradesh for many decades." He added, "Despite being in Opposition, Mulayam Singh ji had good relations with everyone."

382.title: Yuvraj Singh gets trolled for his 'Welcome to 700 club' tweet for Ronaldo
382.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has been trolled for his 'Welcome to 700 club' tweet for Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo. Yuvraj posted the tweet to congratulate Ronaldo on reaching 700 club goals. "He's only one in 700 club," a user wrote. "Which 700 club are you in...my good sir?" wrote another. "Welcome? He scored 700 goals...not runs," another tweet read.

383.title: More will come: Ten Hag on Ronaldo's 1st Premier League goal of the season
383.article_body: Talking about Cristiano Ronaldo's first Premier League goal of the season on Sunday, Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag said, "He had to wait for it but I'm sure more goals will come." Notably, Ronaldo's first goal of the season is also his 700th club goal in top-level football. "That's really impressive when you score 700 goals," added Ten Hag.

384.title: Not many can hit sixes as early like I do: Ishan Kishan on not rotating strike
384.article_body: Talking about valuing six-hitting more than rotating strike, Ishan Kishan, who scored 93(84) in second ODI against South Africa, said, "Rotating strike is some players' strength, while some prefer hitting sixes." He added, "Not many can hit sixes as early like I do...if I can do my bit by hitting sixes...I don’t think of rotating that much," he added.

385.title: Road built as part of ₹19.5-cr project in B’luru caves in 4 months after inauguration
385.article_body: A service road built as a part of a ₹19.5-crore underpass in Bengaluru, caved in on Sunday, four months after its inauguration. While the repair was underway and may take a few more days, as per a report, the cave-in at the Kundalahalli underpass happened because a pipe under it broke and water seeped in over the last few days.

386.title: Jaishankar reaches Australia, shares pic of old Parliament house in Tiranga colours
386.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar reached Australia on Monday and tweeted, "Arrived in Canberra to a Tiranga welcome. So happy to see the old Parliament house of Australia in our national colours." "We spoke about a lot of issues like economy, trade, education, defence and  clean energy," said Jaishankar in a joint presser with Australian Foreign Affairs Minister at Canberra.

387.title: Roadblocks to be put up only at night on Mumbai-B'luru Highway: Pune Police
387.article_body: The Pune Police said that roadblocks on Mumbai-Bengaluru Highway at Chandani Chowk in Pune will stay in place only during the night. The announcement comes after the 20 minutes traffic block done at 1 pm on Sunday led to massive traffic jam in the area. The block was done for rock blasting amid ongoing construction of the new bridge.

388.title: He was a very accessible person: Azmi after Mulayam Singh's demise
388.article_body: Mourning the passing away of veteran politician Mulayam Singh Yadav, actress Shabana Azmi said that he was "a very accessible person" and "a tall leader in national politics and UP governance". Shabana called Mulayam Singh Yadav "a son of the soil". Actor Anupam Kher also remembered meeting the late politician and said he "always used to meet cheerfully".

389.title: Singapore's life expectancy declines for the first time since 1957
389.article_body: Singapore's life expectancy declined by two months in 2021, marking the first time it has fallen since records were first kept in 1957. Officials from Department of Statistics attributed the decline to COVID-19, the fifth-most common cause of death in the city-state last year. Singapore's life expectancy at birth was 83.5 years in 2021, compared with 83.7 years in 2019.

390.title: NFT marketplace OpenSea CFO resigns after 10 months
390.article_body: NFT marketplace OpenSea CFO Brian Roberts has resigned ten months after assuming the position and will remain an advisor to the company. The firm's VP of finance Justin Jow will take on the role following Roberts' departure. Earlier this year, OpenSea fired 20% of its workforce to prepare "for the possibility of a prolonged downturn" in the digital asset market.

391.title: Rachakonda Police chief takes part in 'Pureathon'; pics surface
391.article_body: Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh Bhagwat on Sunday participated in a 'Pureathon', which was "a 2k/5k run, walk" organised by PURE NGO's Shyla Talluri to raise awareness about menstruation, police said. Police also shared pictures from the event. Moreover, Bhagwat appealed to people to install sanitary pad vending machines and incinerators at workplaces, hostels and public toilets for women.

392.title: End of an era in Indian politics: Shah on Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise
392.article_body: Condoling the demise of Samajwadi Party (SP) founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that he remained active in politics for decades with his unique political skills. "His demise marks the end of an era in Indian politics," Shah tweeted. "During the Emergency, he raised his voice for the restoration of democracy," he added.

393.title: Tesla delivered record 83,135 China-made EVs in September
393.article_body: A report by China Passenger Car Association has revealed that Tesla delivered record 83,135 China-made electric vehicles in September, smashing a record set in June earlier. It is an 8% increase from August. "The record high sales of China-made Tesla cars showed electric vehicles have been leading the mobility trend," Tesla said.

394.title: Amazon to invest $975 million in European electric van, truck fleet
394.article_body: Amazon will invest nearly $975 million in electric vans, trucks and low-emission package hubs across Europe, over the next five years. It said the investment will help push its electric van fleet in Europe from 3,000 vehicles to more than 10,000 by 2025. It aims to buy over 1,500 electric heavy goods vehicles in the coming years.

395.title: Priyanka Gandhi condoles demise of ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav
395.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Monday condoled the demise of former UP CM and Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. "His incomparable contribution to Indian politics as a former Uttar Pradesh CM, Defence Minister...and a strong advocate of social justice will always be remembered," Priyanka tweeted. Yadav passed away at Medanta Hospital in Haryana's Gurugram.

396.title: UP govt announces 3-day state mourning on Mulayam Singh Yadav's demise
396.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government has announced a three-day state mourning on the demise of Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav. Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath took to Twitter to make the announcement. The Chief Minister also said that Yadav's last rites will be performed with full state honours. The SP founder passed away on Monday.

397.title: Landslide amid heavy rains in Venezuela leaves 22 dead, 52 missing
397.article_body: At least 22 people died and 52 others are missing after a river overflowed causing a landslide in Venezuela's Las Tejerias amid heavy rains, officials said. The country's President Nicolás Maduro announced three days of national mourning in solidarity with the affected families from Sunday. "I never thought that something of this magnitude could happen," a citizen said.

398.title: Dhawan 'thanks' Keshav for opting to bat, says dew came in at right time
398.article_body: Team India stand-in captain Shikhar Dhawan thanked South Africa's stand-in skipper Keshav Maharaj for opting to bat after winning the toss in their second ODI on Sunday. "Worked perfectly well for us...dew came in at the right time," said Dhawan jokingly after the game. India chased down SA's 278-run total in 45.5 overs to win by seven wickets.

399.title: Breaks my heart: Devoleena on Sajid's participation in 'Bigg Boss 16'
399.article_body: Television actress Devoleena Bhattacharjee said it breaks her heart to see Sajid Khan on national television and "trying to prove he is a hero". Sajid is one of the contestants in Salman Khan's 'Bigg Boss 16'. He was accused of sexual misconduct during the #MeToo movement. "It appears that you may do anything and enter 'Bigg Boss'," Devoleena added.

400.title: Ronaldo creates history, becomes 1st player to score 700 club goals in top-level football
400.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo on Sunday created history by becoming the first-ever player to score 700 club goals in top-level football. The 37-year-old reached the milestone by netting the winner in the 44th minute in a Premier League match against Everton. Ronaldo's 700 goals have come in 943 games for Sporting Lisbon, Manchester United, Real Madrid and Juventus.
